texts.fr: Blandine est une femme de 49 ans, marié et mère de 05 enfants. elle possède une petite usine où elle détaille et vend des détergents en sachet dans une quartier de la ville depuis 1 an.elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des détergents en sac pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses bénéfices. les profits générés vont être injecter dans son capital afin de l'augmenter d'une part et vont subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, santé, nutrition) d'autre part.
texts.en: Blandine is a woman of 49, married and the mother of five children. She has had a little factory where she packages and sells detergents by the envelope in a district of the town for one year. She is asking for this loan to buy detergents by the bag to expand her stock of merchandise so that she can expand her turnover and grow her profit. The profit generated by this will in part go into increasing her working capital, and in part will be used for family needs (education, healthcare and nutrition).

loans.use: to buy detergent wholesale.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena owns a small business. She sells women's clothing at a local market. Summer is a high season for Olena since her town is a resort place (it is located on the Azov Sea) and many people visit it during summer. 

Olena would like to increase her assortment of women's summer clothing. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH that will help her to increase her sales and make additional income. 

Olena has a hobby: a small garden where she grows vegetables and fruits. Her dream is to build a small summer house and be able to live there in summer.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of summer clothing

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois abritant ce groupe a été créé le 01/02/2000. Il est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même village et font toutes le commerce.Ndèye est la représentante du groupe elle est âgée de 58 ans ,marié et mère de 3 enfants don 2 garçons de 35 et 18 ans et une fille de 10 ans. Elle est placé a l’extrême droite de la photo et porte le boubou bleu blanc. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 20 sacs de mil à 250000f et 6 sacs de haricot à 150000f.Ses bénéfices réalisées lui permette de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire de sa famille.et de renforcer ses épargnes dans le BV.
texts.en: The "banc villageois" that this group belongs to was created on the 1st of February,  2000. It is made up of 6 women who live in the same village and are all retailers. Ndèye is the group representative. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, 2 boys who are 35 and 18 years old, and one 10-year-old girl. She is standing on the far right in the picture and wearing the blue and white boubou. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 bags of millet (at 250 000 per bag) and 6 bags of beans (at 150 000 francs per bag). The profits generated by her business allow her to take care of her family's food needs and to build her savings in the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of millet and 6 bags of beans.

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sekera  est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Ufalme», doyenne, entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 61 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants  dont 4 étudient tous et les autres ont déjà leurs propre foyers. La cliente est vendeuse Maïs. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 30 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Sekera, the customer, is an advisor to the "Ufalme" business group. A doyenne and experienced, dynamic entrepreneur, she is 61 years old, widowed and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom go to school. The others already have their own households. Sekera sells maize. She displays her products at home. She started her business about 30 years ago with her own funds, received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy 4 bags of maize. She would like to increase her business, feed and educate her children and buy them a plot of land. The lack of sufficient capital is a challenge to the growth of her business. Finally, she wishes to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of maize.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 23 mai 2002. Les membres qui le composent vivent une parfaite solidarité et s’entraident. Elles font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont une fille.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire du commerce et l'embouche. Elle va acheter 6 moutons à 150 000f et un bœuf à 200 000f. Avec le reste de l'argent elle va mener son commerce: vente d'huile, de savon, du poison séché et autres produits. 
Les bénéfices lui servent à épargner et renforcer son embouche.
texts.en: This group of 6 women is part of the "banc villageois" which was created on the 23rd of May, 2002. Its members have a close-knit unity and help each other. They are retailers and also fatten livestock. Amy, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children, one of whom is a girl. She plans to invest the loan she receives in her retail and livestock-fattening businesses. She will buy 6 sheep at 150 000 francs each and an oxen for 200 000 francs. She will use the rest of the money for her retail business, selling oil, soap, dried fish and other products. She uses her profits to build her savings and reinforce her livestock-fattening business.

loans.use: to buy various food products, 6 sheep and one oxen.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María, a sus 65 años de edad es madre cabeza de hogar, pues su esposo la abandonó hace muchos años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a trabajar en el sector de confecciones, laboró en diferentes empresas como operaria y actualmente presta el servicio de bordado y terminación de prendas para algunos talleres de confección del sector donde reside. Durante todos los años que laboró, pudo ahorrar y adquirir propiedades, de las cuales hoy en día recibe una renta mensual, con lo que ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar. María  es una señora pujante, organizada, emprendedora y muy dedicada a su familia y a su labor, ella manifiesta que “su edad no es impedimento para hacer lo que le gusta”. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una máquina plana e insumos para continuar realizando su labor y poder obtener más contratos, lo que le ayudará a cumplir el sueño de comprar máquinas recubridoras para poder conseguir contratos con nuevas empresas y además desea capacitarse en el manejo de las mismas, esto le permitirá brindar oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 65 years old and head of her household, for her husband left her many years ago. She has been a seamstress for twenty years, first in the employ of several clothing companies, and now for a few workshops in her area, where she does embroidery and puts the finishing touches on clothes. María was fortunate enough to save money and to buy houses, from which she now derives a monthly income, which she needs to pay for household expenses. She is very determined, organised, and full of enterprising spirit. She is also very devoted to both her family and her work, and proudly states that her age does not get in the way of her doing what she likes. María asks for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine and supplies, so as to keep working and get more orders to fulfill. This will enable her to make her dream of buying more sophisticated sewing machines come true. This way, she would be able to fulfill orders for more workshops. She also wants to learn how to use these machines so as to then give single mothers an employment opportunity and improve her standard of living as well as theirs.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a sewing machine) and supplies.

loans.name: Ephata Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwambikwa est leader du collectif  d’affaire  « Ephata», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  1 ballon de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Mwambikwa is the leader of the Ephata business group. A young experienced entrepreneur, Mwambikwa is 36 years old and a mother of five children, who all go to school. Her husband sells various goods for a living. 

Mwambikwa sells second-hand clothing. She displays her goods in a market, and sometimes at home. She started her business about two years ago with funds from her husband.

This new loan will serve to buy one bale of second-hand clothing. 

Mwambikwa wishes to increase her business and to educate and feed her children.

Finally, Mwambikwa strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
La señora Elda es estudiante universitaria de la carrera de enfermería, ella le ayuda su marido con los gastos, ya que están trabajando juntos y viven en casa propia.
Su meta es de tener su titulo y poder trabajar, para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es muy sacrificada y está luchando por poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que quiere poder cubrir el costo de su titulación, ya que es un poco costoso. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Elda is a university student; she is studying to become a nurse. Her husband helps her with the expenses, since they work and live together. They live in a house of their own.

Her goal is to receive a degree in order to be able to work and help her family. She is a hardworking person who is fighting to improve her and her family’s life.

Elda is requesting a loan to pay for the high cost of officially registering her degree. She appreciates this opportunity.

loans.use: to officially register her degree.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a mobile shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of cell phones and mobile accessories, including hands-free, mobile chargers, etc., in his shop.

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to a lack of capital, he finds this difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Sughran, as a memeber of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. In this way, she can help her husband to purchase a variety of cell phones and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sughran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cell phones and mobile accessories.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 25 years old, not yet married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Mahmud  is a Fuzulu refugee. He is a worker who repairs cars. He has been in this field since his childhood, and he established his own business in 2009. He has good experience in this field and employs two people. He is well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices. He is a very talented person.

Now Mahmud wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery in his garage. With a good loan history, he has applied for his 5th  loan of 1,500 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery in his garage.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Ruth, who is in her mid-30s, is single with a son who is in school. For seven months now, Ruth has had a retail shop selling different products like baking flour, maize flour, sugar, airtime, sweets, etc. Previously, Ruth had been running a genge business selling fruits and vegetables, but she closed it due to low returns compared to her current business.  

Ruth starts working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit per month. This is her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock more shop products like dry food items. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened her previous business and the current one. With the business profit earned, she covered home expenses. She also used the profit to cover her son's school fees, which are now high compared to previously because she changed schools for her son from a government one to a private one (English-medium school). Ruth dreams that one day, she will be able to own a big wholesale business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Jaguar," which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more shop products like dry food items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with two children who are infant and school-aged. Maricel is 31 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Maricel is engaged in a food-vending activity to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to be used for purchasing additional vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, carrots,  etc. 

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for two years and shows a good credit record. In the future, Maricel hopes to expand and improve her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo, 56, is a married man and an entrepreneur living in Sampaguita. He sells various grocery items in his store and gains about 5,000 PHP each month in income. He reinvests his income into his business to keep gaining good profits. Some of his profits were spent to supply their immediate needs. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of merchandise like noodles, eggs, breads, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. In the future, Wilfredo hopes to continue operating his business and extending good products and services to all his customers.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, breads, canned goods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, two of whom are in school, Inda works hard to support her family.

Inda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 30000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills. 

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of diseases. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), she wants to purchase 150 chickens and seven sacks of chicken feed for better production. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 150 chickens and seven sacks of chicken feed for better production.

loans.name: Michael

texts.ru:
Михаил женат. Он работает начальником охраны на железной дороге. Михаил молодой и ответственный. Сейчас он проживет в доме вместе с женой и родителями. Через полгода они ожидают пополнение в своей семье.

Михаил просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на ремонт комнаты. В данный момент комната не пригодна для проживания. Он хочет положить на потолок гиптокартон, пошпаклевать и покрасить. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия его семьи.
texts.en:
Michael is married. He works as a head of security of the railway. Michael is young and responsible. Right now he lives at home with his wife and parents. They are expecting a new member in the family in six months.

Michael is asking to provide him with a loan in the amount of 6,000 hryvnas to repair a room. At this time the room in his apartment is not suitable for living. He wants to put sheet rock on the ceiling, to plaster and to paint it. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik has always dreamt of becoming a professional. Erik is currently attending the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in October 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. With this loan, Erik plans on using the funds to pay his graduation fees. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. With three younger brothers and one younger sister, Erik hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en: Maritza dreams of becoming a professional but, without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Maritza is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in business. She plans to graduate in December 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. Maritza plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Maritza earns $8 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $15 a day. With two older siblings attending college already, Maritza is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Maritza currently works 25 hours a week to help afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Monica Flavia

texts.en: Monica has always dreamed of becoming a professional. Monica is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree in business. She plans to graduate in March 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. Monica plans to use the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Monica currently works 40 hours a week and earns $15 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $25 a day. Unfortunately, Monica's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Monica is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Monica currently works as a cashier.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has one child who is still underage and does not go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mwanamisi has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sewing machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa es una joven de 17 años que va a estudiar Lic. en Educación, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de sostenimiento, transporte y libros. Esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Vanesa, nací en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, tengo 17 años, a la edad de 13 años mi padre murió y mi madre quedo sola y es quien me ha sostenido con sacrificio, mi madre trabaja como secretaria, su salario a penas nos alcanza para los gastos fijos y alimentarnos, quiero lograr mi sueño de ser profesional en Educación y ella no me puede pagar los estudios ya que no es suficiente con su salario.
 
Con el beneficio de este préstamo podré costear los libros, materiales y transporte, ya que mi madre no lo puede pagar, y realizar el sueño de trabajar enseñando y ayudando a niños con problemas de aprendizaje y también ayudando personas a leer y escribir que nunca fueron a una escuela, como un aporte al desarrollo de mi país. 

Este préstamo representa mi esperanza de poder lograr mi sueño de ser profesional y de esta manera ayudar a mi madre y devolverle de cierta forma el esfuerzo que ella ha hecho por sacarme adelante a raíz de la muerte de mi padre.

Espero poder contar con una mano amiga para lograr este sueño.

Se despide


Vanesa.
texts.en:
Vanesa, 17, is a young woman who will be getting a Bachelor’s in Education.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to pay for sustenance, transportation and textbooks.  This is her story:

My name is Vanesa.  I was born in the city of Santo Domingo.  I’m 17-years-old.  My father died when I was 13 and my mother was left alone; she has sacrificed to support me.  My mother works as a secretary and her salary is barely enough to pay for fixed costs and food.  I want to reach my dream of becoming a professional educator but she’s unable to pay for my schooling because her salary is insufficient.

With the benefit of this loan, I’ll be able to pay for texts, supplies and transportation because my mother’s unable to pay for them and to reach my dream of working teaching and helping children with learning problems and also to contribute to my country by helping people who never went to school to learn to read and write.

This loan represents my hope of being able to reach my dream of becoming a professional to help my mother this way somehow repaying her for all the effort she’s made to move me ahead after my father’s death.

I hope to find a friendly hand to help me attain this dream.

Farewell,
Vanesa

loans.use: to pay for textbooks, transportation and sustenance while studying Education.

loans.name: Blasina

texts.es:
Blasina es una joven estudiante de Odontología, ella está solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios. Esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Blasina, soy nativa y resido en municipio de Hato Viejo, Yamasa, Monte Plata en el Noreste de la Republica Dominicana, tengo 20 años de edad, soy una estudiante de escasos recursos y debido a la condición de mi familia, me es muy difícil costearme los estudios ya que los recursos económicos de mis padres son muy limitados y yo no cuento con un empleo.  Tengo una familia numerosa; de 8 hermanos y los ingresos de mi padre que es chofer de carro público;  apenas nos alcanza para comer cada día  porque somos once en total.
Tengo mis sueños de tener una carrera, en mi comunidad hace falta gente con voluntad para poder echar para adelante a Hato Viejo, mi deseo es poder llevar un granito de arena a esta gente que tanto lo necesita al igual que a mi familia. Actualmente soy  voluntaria en un programa de alfabetización para mi comunidad que se llama “Quisqueya Aprende contigo”  lo cual me llena de satisfacción. 
Actualmente estudio odontología  en UPHEC, universidad en la cual sus maestros son muy capacitados, pero para poder hacerlo necesito RD$251,000  que me permitirá  cubrir la matrícula de la   carrera,  pero tengo la limitante de que no puedo costearme los costos de la misma.
Este préstamo es necesario para mí, para poder lograr mi sueño y contribuir con mi comunidad, sin  la ayuda de este préstamo me sería  imposible seguir cursando mi carrera, ya que me abriría las  puertas que en este momento están cerradas para mí y para mi familia que necesita de mi apoyo por lo que   espero poder contar con una mano generosa o varias  que apuesten a mí para poder cumplir mi gran sueño de ser odontóloga y después yo pueda seguir apoyando  a otros cuando logre  ser profesional.
texts.en:
Blasina is a young woman who studies dentistry. She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies. This is her story:

My name is Blasina; I was born and raised in the municipality of Hato Viejo, Yamasa, Monte Plata, located in Northeastern Dominican Republic. I am 20 years old. I am a student with limited resources, and due to my family’s economic condition, it is difficult for me to pay for my studies. My parents do not make enough and I am unemployed. I have a large family: eight siblings supported by my father, who is a public-transport driver and makes barely enough to feed a family of eleven.

My dream is to become a professional. My community lacks people that are willing to help Hato Viejo to progress. I would like to give a small contribution to these people who have many needs, such as my family. I am currently working as a volunteer in a literacy program in my community, called “Quisqueya aprende contigo” [Quisqueya learns with you], which fills my heart with satisfaction.

I am studying dentistry in UPHEC, a university with well-prepared teachers. However, I need RD$251,000 [DOP] in order to pay for the tuition fee and I do not have them.

This loan is important for me, in order to make my dream come true and contribute to my community. Without it, it would be impossible for me to continue with my studies, which can open doors that would otherwise be closed for me and my family. They need my support and I hope to have one or several helping hands that believe in me and in my dream of becoming a dentist. When I become a professional, I will be able to support others as well.

loans.use: to pay for the university's tution fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his studies in marketing

loans.name: Nelson Marcelo

texts.en:
Nelson dreams of becoming a professional but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Nelson has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. He plans to graduate in June 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. Nelson plans to use his loan to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Unfortunately, Nelson's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. Nelson currently works 25 hours a week as a security guard to help afford his school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Mariela Claudia

texts.en:
Mariela has always dreamed of becoming a professional. Mariela was accepted into the Universidad Pública De El Alto and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording graduation fees. She expects to graduate in October 2013 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Mariela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Mariela plans to use the loan funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With two other siblings, Mariela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Mariela currently works 30 hours a week as an architect to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Jhosmar Natalio

texts.en: Jhosmar dreams of becoming a professional. He was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording his books. He plans to graduate in December 2013 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Jhosmar plans to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Jhosmar currently works 30 hours a week and earns $10 a day. With a career in business, he expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling already attending college, Jhosmar is unsure how he will be able to afford his school supplies on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Jhosmar currently works as a consultant to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Fidel Jhonatan

texts.en:
Fidel dreams of becoming a professional but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Fidel is currently attending the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi, working towards his degree in business. He expects to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Fidel shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Fidel plans to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Fidel's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of six, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling already attending college, Fidel is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Fidel currently works 40 hours a week as a cook.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una persona joven, estudiante con ganas de salir adelante, para cumplir las metas y objetivos propuestos, tratar de ayudar a sus padres, tener un buen trabajo con buen ingreso el que pueda ayudar a solventar sus gastos de manera independiente.
Está estudiando la carrera de psicología forense, una carrera apasionante que le gusta mucho. Es muy sacrificada y quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de  su universidad, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Silvia is a young student who wants to get ahead and meet her goals and objectives. These include helping her parents and having a good job with a good income so she can pay her bills independently. 

She is doing a degree in forensic psychology - an exciting program that she really enjoys. She is very hard-working and wants to get ahead by working. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university tuition. It would be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is 58 years old and married with four children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Safura is a Fuzulu refugee. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, and other dishes. Safura earns 140 AZN each month which is very profitable. She works with her husband and they keep a flock of sheep in their yard to fatten. Safura takes the meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. 

Safura is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. She is optimistic about her loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep to sell more meat in the summer

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional computer parts and supplies and have her computers maintained. Her income from the loan helped her in sending her children to school. She has been in this business for only two years, but her computer shop is continuously growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Liberty would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 30,000, to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liberty dreams to have many branches and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a 33-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Asma's husband is an electrician by profession. 

Asma is the leader of two-person loan group requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase switches, switch boards, wires, and electric instruments for her husband. Asma's husband will be able to offer more variety to his customers and she hopes that her loan will be helpful for his business. Asma is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase switches, switch boards, wires, and electric instruments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to produce vegetables

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has a restaurant in the Philippines. She has run her business for 36 years now and  she earns additional income from raising pigs. Lourdes works hard to support her family. 

Lourdes is requesting a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, and vegetables. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a 44-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janeth has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Janeth applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell. Janeth has been in this business for a year. In the future, Janeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 57 years old and married with three children, none of whom are in school. She is rice farmer and has been raising pigs for the last four years. Luzvilla has received eight previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Luzvilla is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to expand her business to secure the financial of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt.Kenya. He is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. He has practiced farming for over fifteen years. His sources of income are cash crops, cereals, and milk.

James wants to purchase a chaff cutter for cutting napier grass for his dairy cows. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 for purchasing it. This will increase his animal feed and, thus, increase production. This will increase his income base which will allow James to give better education to his child and also improve his family's living standards. The major challenges he faces are poor markets and poor transportation/infrastructure. 

In five years, James wants to have purchased a cooling plant for his milk production. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for making the loan available to him.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Sirac

texts.en: Sirac is 28 years old and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sirac is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than eight years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Sirac’s income from business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This will require a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds for his fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is 60 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school. Jasmin is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jasmin applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bottles of pesticides to sell. Jasmin has been farming rice for six years, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Jasmin would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bottles of pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "malagkit"(glutinous rice), coconut, sugar and other ingredients needed in cooking rice cake and "puto pao" (meat buns) for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 38-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is eight months old. She engages in retail business. She produces nipa (palm thatch) to be used as roofing material for thatched houses and dwellings. She sells nipa to earn for a living. Her husband works as a carpenter. To continue her livelihood activity, Jennifer applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP buy more nipa and bamboo to meet customer demand. In the future, Jennifer would like to expand her nipa-making business to be able to send all her children for college educations.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm and bamboo to make thatch to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a fertile area for agricultural production, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has two children, all of whom are of schoolgoing age. He has practiced farming for over fifteen years. His income is mainly from cash crops and horticultural crops. He wants to purchase a water tank and water pipes for irrigation purposes, and he has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, of KES 40,000, to undertake the project. This loan will boost his production, because there will be continuous irrigation, thus making his crops do well. Profit from the increased production will help improve his family's living standard. The challenge he faces are insects, diseases, and poor transportation. In five years he wants to have acquired a pick-up truck. Joseph appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for its quick loan processing.

loans.use: to buy water pumps and pipes to irrigate his farm.

loans.name: Zavkiya

texts.en:
Zavkiya is a wonderful woman. She is married. As her husband has not a good source of income, she is the main bread-winner in her family. It is very difficult for her to provide her husband, son and her mother-in-law with all necessities. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than nine years. She works at this business with pleasure. She likes animals. 

Zaykiya was born and grew up in a village, so she has a great experience in this field. She buys animals at the local market and fattens them in her barn. After some months she resells the animals at the local market. Her husband helps her with the business.

Zaykiya wants to increase the number of cattle she presently has. Currently she is asking for a loan of 8000 somoni to buy cattle. This is her first loan from IMON. She is hardworking and an honest woman. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Qardashxan

texts.en:
Qardashxan is a 58-year-old man who is married with three sons. He is an internally displaced person (IDP).  For the past 20 years, Qardashxan has been engaged in cattle breeding and he sells milk and dairy products to the local vendors. Milk and milk products are in high demand and provide a stable income. Qardashxan earns 230 AZN each month. 

Qardashxan is requesting a  2,000 AZN loan to purchase a milk cow and a calf to increase his sales. This is his third loan and he has a good loan history. Qardashxan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf to increase his sales

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en: Elxan is 48 years old, married, and the father of four kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. Elxan started his business 20 years ago, repairing cars. Now he needs a loan of 1800 AZN to repair his workshop. He wants to use the profits he earns for his children’s future. In the future, Elxan wants to have a second business location and an employee. This will enable his business to be more profitable. This is Elxan's second loan. He is thankful to Aqroinvest and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for his organic vegetable and fruit business.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is 28 years old and single. He lives in Cantabon, Siquijor. For the past two years, Eleazar has been a farmer. He earns 1,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC.

Eleazar is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy household goods to sell in her store, including oil, rice, eggs, shampoo and other groceries. Jonalyn has been in this business for eight years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell, such as oil, rice, eggs, shampoo,  and other groceries.

loans.name: Saraveya

texts.en:
Saraveya appreciates her previous loan that enabled her generate more profit by adding stock to her restaurant. She is grateful for the Kiva loan that has enabled her boost her restaurant business.

Saraveya is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase 50 kilograms of rice, a bale of wheat flour, chicken, and maize flour for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, chicken, and maize flour

loans.name: Rafael Arcángel

texts.es: Rafael a sus 50 años de edad es padre soltero de 2 hijos. Desde hace muchos años inició su propio negocio, un taller donde fabrica calzado, esta actividad la aprendió cuando trabajaba en una empresa como operario. Luego de que la madre de sus hijos lo abandonara, Rafael pasó por muchas situaciones precarias, pues no tenía quien lo apoyara con el cuidado de sus hijos, por lo que decidió independizarse, para poderse encargar de sus hijos y además tener tiempo para trabajar y generar los ingresos que solventan sus necesidades. El titular es un hombre amable, pujante, activo, trabajador y dedicado a sus hijos, por los que lucha incansablemente, trabajando arduas jornadas de Lunes a Domingo, para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (cordones, cuero, pintura, suelas, caucho) con el fin de tener materia prima disponible y variada para entregar los pedidos a tiempo y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, con lo que obtendrá más ingresos por ventas y así podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es fortalecer su negocio para poder generar oportunidades de empleo y así tener la posibilidad de brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que tengan un futuro próspero y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael, 50, is single and the father of two children. He started his own business many years ago: a shoemaker’s workshop. He learned this activity while he was working for a company. After the children’s mother abandoned them, Rafael had difficult times since he had no one to take care of the children. This is why he decided to become independent in order to take care of them and have time to focus on working and making a living.

Rafael is a kind, enthusiastic, energetic and hardworking man devoted to his children. He works hard for them, Monday to Sunday, fighting to help them to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (shoestrings, leather, paints, soles, rubber) in order to have the raw material he needs to deliver his customers’ orders on time and satisfy their demands. This will result in more profits from his sales and will help him to reach his goal, which is to strengthen the business and create job opportunities. He also wants to give his children a better education so that they can have a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (shoestrings, leather, paint, soles and rubber).

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife, 9-year-old daughter, and parents.  The entire family is actively involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, they have 4 milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products.  They also have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown.  David works hard to ensure a good harvest.  

He decided to start his own business because his current income is seasonal and not enough for the family.  All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, David applied for the credit to MFO Credo.  His request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative, start-up program with Kiva.  This program permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $4,300 will help David to purchase all the needed raw materials to build a greenhouse.  Once the greenhouse is built, he will be able to grow tomatoes and greens and generate a more stable income.  This will help David to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a married man and has been blessed with one child, who attends school. They live at their own house, which has electricity but no piped water. He has operated a cereal business for over six years. It operates at the market, where his neighbours are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase bags of beans for resale. He dreams of expanding his business by opening up a wholesale cereal shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of beans for sale, in hope of expanding his business by opening up a wholesale cereal shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Asha dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 10 crates of sodas, 20 kg of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat/oil.

loans.use: to purchase 10 crates of sodas, 20 kg of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat/oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a machine and other supplies for his work

loans.name: Rojita

texts.en: Rojita is 28 years old and married. She has one child. She runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan, of $1,200. She will buy some additional supplies to stock her store, such as noodles, soft drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, oil, body loosener and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soft  drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and oils to stock her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the small village of Khelvachauri district.  She lives with her mother-in-law, son, daughter-in-law, and two infant grandchildren.  Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension.  

Marina is a very hardworking woman who is actively involved in agricultural activities.  She has 3 milking cows that she milks every day.  She produces cheese products to sell at the local markets.  In addition, she has a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown.  As the existing income is not enough for her family, Marina decided to request a loan for a new business.  All of the financial institutions rejected her loan due to unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Marina applied for credit to MFO Credo.  Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva.  This program permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $5,000 will help Marina to purchase a minibus.  Once purchased, her son will be able to work on the minibus line and receive a stable income.  This will guarantee to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is a 37-year-old married man who lives in the small village of Kobuleti district with his wife, Gulnara, and parents.  Gulnara is a teacher at the local public school.  Edvard is actively involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where nut trees and mandarin trees are grown.  He sells the harvested products at the local markets. 

As the existing income is seasonal and not enough for a four-member family, Edvard decided to start his own business.  All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Edvard applied for the credit to MFO Credo.  His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva.  This program enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $3,000 will help him to purchase a minibus.  Once the minibus is purchased, he will work on the minibus line and increase the family income.  With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on the minibus line.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add one more cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es madre soltera y dispone de una habitación en la casa de su madre en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella es chofer de microbus, trabajo que realiza por mas de diez horas al día. Requiere el crédito para realizar un mantenimiento completo de su vehículo.

El sueño de Gisela es poder salir de la casa de su Madre e independizarse en una casa propia.
texts.en: Gisela is a single mother and has a room in her mother's house in the San Martin area of the city of La Paz. She is microbus driver, work she does for more than ten hours a day. She needs the loan in order to carry out a complete maintenance of her vehicle. Gisela's dream is to be able to leave her mother's house and become independent in her own home.

loans.use: To maintain her microbus.

loans.name: Majallon

texts.en:
Majallon is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. For the past year, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling shoes. Majallon works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans from NWTF.

Majallon is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, married, and has nine children.  

Maria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been business for 37 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, el vive con su familia que la componen su esposa y su hijo  de dos años, para los cuales el trabaja ya que no recibe ayuda de nadie más y es el único sostén de su casa.
Víctor, se dedica a la venta de pollos, el dice que este es un oficio de familia, para venderlos el sale muy temprano de su hogar lo cual, el manifiesta que lo hace con mucho agrado, ya que es el sostén de su familia.
El  solicita el crédito para invertir en compra de pollos de engorde y de esa manera poder agrandar su negocio, mejorar las ventas y poder incrementar sus ganancias; además  manifiesta que uno de sus mayores sueños es tener una granja con más de dos mil pollos y poder vender en el mercado,  así obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his family which consists of his wife and a two year old child. He works to support them as the sole breadwinner with no help from anyone else. Victor sells chickens, he says this is the family trade. He gets up very early to sell them. He explains that he does this with pleasure, as this is how he supports his family. 

Victor is asking for this loan in order to buy broilers (chickens), Doing this he can make his business bigger, increase his sales and his revenue. He states that one of his biggest dreams is to have a farm with over two thousand chickens and be able to sell in the market, thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy broilers (chickens).

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 50-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Saeeda's husband owns a clothing boutique which is the only source of income for the family. He presently needs additional capital for the growth of his business. 

Saeeda is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to prepare dresses to sell. Her loan will help him to offer greater variety to his customers. He will use the profit from the loan to set aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bill. Saeeda hopes that her loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: John Smith

texts.es: John a sus 21 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Luego de terminar sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a laborar como ayudante de construcción, pero con el fin de generar unos ingresos más estables decidió montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece mecato, galletería, gaseosas, carnes frías, entre otros. Esta actividad la aprendió de un amigo, y para conseguir los ingresos suficientes para el sustento de su familia, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo. Cuenta con el apoyo de una persona que trabaja esporádicamente, especialmente en los días que él tiene contratos en construcción. John es un joven dinámico, entusiasta, pujante y emprendedor, su principal motivación para seguir adelante son sus padres. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un enfriador, pues el que posee actualmente lo debe dividir para guardar las carnes y el pollo y las gaseosas, afectando la salubridad y la higiene de los productos, ya que se pueden contaminar y por lo tanto ocasionar pérdidas. Con esto podrá brindar una mejor imagen a su negocio y los productos no se contaminarán, con lo cual podrá aumentar su margen de ganancia por ventas, esto le permitirá fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: John is 21 years old, single, and has no children.  After completing high school, he started working as a construction assistant, but since he wanted to have a more stable income, he decided to start his own business; a grocery store where he sells groceries, cookies, cold cuts, and other things.  He learned this business from a friend and works Monday through Sunday in order to earn enough income for his family.  He has help from another person who works sporadically, especially on days when he has construction contracts.  John is a young, dynamic, vigorous, enterprising man whose main motivation is to get ahead with his parents.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a cooler, because the one he has he must use to store the meats, chicken, and soft drinks, affecting the health and sanitation of the products and also risking contamination which will result in losses.  With this he can present a better image for his business, his products won’t get contaminated, and he will be able to increase his profit margin.  This will allow him to strengthen his business and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is a 25-year-old, married, young customer and father of one daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Rasim  is very kind, caring, and energetic in his work. Rasim raises cattle, fattening them and selling them for a profitable price. His wife is the major support for him in this business.

Rasim sells meat at the central bazaar for a profit. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kebabs, and dolma. His income from this business is AZN 180 per month. In order to fully support the family, Rasim is looking forward to expanding the business and making it very successful.

He has applied for his first loan of  AZN 2,000 from Aqroinvest, to buy five calves. Rasim, at this very young age, and with a great passion and energy, plans to become a successful businessman in the town.

loans.use: to buy five calves.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Serapio; el tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien trabaja en una empresa publica,el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el credito para   comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y fideos para la tienda de abarrotes.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Serapio is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Kamer” which is located in the District of Coya, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children.

Serapio divides his time between his daily activities and managing his grocery store. He also works at a public company. Serapio sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. He has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. His dream is to expand his grocery store.

Serapio is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as rice, sugar, and noodles for his grocery store. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Ma. Nimpha

texts.en:
Ma. Nimpha is a 33-year-old, married woman, from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is ten, while the youngest is one year old. 

Ma. Nimpha engages in fishing. She sells fish. She has been selling fish for more than five years. 

Ma. Nimpha requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fishing gear and to purchase a new pump boat, to improve her catch and augment her income. 

She would like to expand her fishing business, to support her children to become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and purchase a new pump boat.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, está soltera, tiene 3 hijos que estudian y no recibe ayuda económica  de nadie, se dedica a la venta de marisco variado profesión que aprendió gracias a unas amistades y desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta.
Ella solicita un crédito para compra de pescado, camarones, jaiba y otros; de esa manera obtener mayores ingresos económicos; Blanca pretende mejorar su negocio para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, tener su propio local y así sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Blanca is single, has three children who are students and receives no economic support. She sells various kind of fish, a trade she learned from friends and has practiced over the last fifteen years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fish, shrimp, crab, etc., in this way creating more revenue. Blanca wants to expand her business to offer a higher standard of living to her children. Her dream is to have a bigger business, have her own business premises and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, crab, etc.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny vive con su familia en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Es taxista y trabaja alrededor de 15 horas al día ya que sus hijos son pequeños y su esposa tuvo que renunciar a su trabajo para poder cuidarlos. Antes tenía dos movilidades, ahora solo tiene una y requiere el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de este vehículo.

Jhonny espera cambiar de actividad, le gustaría abrir un negocio o una tienda que le mejore los ingresos y pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhonny lives with his family in the district of San Martín in the city of La Paz. He is a taxi driver and works around 15 hours a day. Since his children are little, his wife had to give up her job to take care of them. Previously he had two taxis, but now he only has one and needs the loan to perform maintenance on this vehicle. 

Jhonny hopes to change jobs. He would like to open a business or a store that would improve his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
Санавбар 39-летняя швея, проживающая в Яванском районе. Она замужем, имеет двух дочерей и одного сына. Ее муж работает мигрантом в России. У Санавбар собственный швейный бизнес. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев на заказ. У нее всегда много заказов и несмотря на нехватку времени она всегда старается выполнить работу качественно и в срок, так как она ответственный человек. Санавбар предоставляет услуги швеи вот уже 6 лет и имеет своих постоянных клиенток. 
В данный момент Санавбару необходимо расширить бизнес. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить швейную машину и машину для утюжно-прессовых работ, а также ткани. Полученную прибыль в будущем она хочет использовать на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sanavbar is 39 year-old dressmaker who lives in Yavan. She is married, and has two daughters and one son. Her husband is a mirgrant worker in Russia. Sanavbar has her own dressmaking business. She works at home making custom ordered traditional Tajik womens' dresses. She always has lots of orders and despite not having enough time, she always tries to finish the job with quality work and on time. Sanavbar has been providing dressmaking services for six years and has her own set of repeat customers.

RIght now Sanavbar needs to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine and an ironing and pressing machine, as well as fabric. She wants to use the profits from the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machines and an ironing and pressing machine, as well as fabric

loans.name: Kaklik

texts.en:
Kaklik is 34 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  

Kaklik buys animals (baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She has a good approach towards business expansion and creating savings for the future. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income, but she needs to improve her  business to meet the needs of her children.

For the improvement of her business, Kaklik applied for a loan of AZN 2,000 to purchase three more cows. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She has a good loan history and this is his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase three more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Crisencia

texts.en: Crisencia is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She is a hog raiser and a fish vendor also. She is very industrious in acquiring income for her family needs. She has been into a hog-raising business for about two years and earns approximately PHP2,000 for each hog disposed. She aims for better income; that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 to buy another hog to raise, and buy its feed and medicines. She hopes to develop her business and continue to grow as a successful hog-raiser someday.

loans.use: to buy a hog to raise and pay for feed and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycles.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas resides in the Nkubu region of eastern Kenya, a very productive land located on the slopes of Mt.Kenya.  He is married, and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

Cosmas has practiced farming for over fifteen years.  His source of income is horticultural crops, milk, and eggs. The challenges he faces are animal pests and diseases, and poor markets.

He wants to purchase poultry, and has asked Juhdi Kilimo for a loan of KES.60,000 to undertake the project.  This will lead to an increase in egg production, and thus more income will be realized. This will help him provide a quality education to his child, and it will also improve his family's standard of living.

Cosmas wishes to expand his poultry farm to over 5,000 poultry, both layers and broilers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Marlyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 53 years old and married with one child who is in school; Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, spices, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for six years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that enabled her to generate profits and pay for her children's school fees.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh.50,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt, wheat flour, and maize flour for her kiosk/retail shop.

She decided to join Yehu to access the loan funds that would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, salt, wheat flour, and maize flour for her kiosk shop.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff like maize flour, potatoes and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 34 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as body lotions, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko and beer. She will also buy books, pens and pencils as well as water noodles and cigarettes. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Patricia is living in a town near the school and her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She is happy with this loan because it could improve her loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotions, Fanta, Cocacola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, and books, pans, pencils, water, noodles and cigarettes.

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cyntia es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Chamoco Chico de la ciudad de La Paz, es comerciante de productos de panes, galletas, panetones, reposteria, etc. No recibe ningun aporte económico por parte del padre de su hijo. Requiere el crédito para el aumento de mercaderia y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.

El sueño de Cyntia es poder independizarse y conseguir un hogar propia para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Cyntia is a single mother who lives in her parents' house in the Chamaco Chico district of the city of La Paz. She sells products such as bread, cookies,  panettoni, pastries, etc. She does not receive any financial support from the father of her son. She needs the loan to increase her merchandise and make her business grow.

Cyntia's dream is to become independent and have her own home for her and her son.

loans.use: to increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en su taller elaborando ventanas de aluminio por mas de diez horas al día ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
Necesita crédito para la compra de una maquina que le sera de mucha ayuda en su taller, ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para comprarla por sí mismo.
El sueño de Luis es construir mas habitaciones para tener mas comodidad y seguridad y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, is single and has no children. He lives in his one-room, brick-walled house, located in Alto Miraflores in the city of La Paz. He works more than 10 hours a day in his shop making aluminum windows, and the little income he earns has to cover his food and basic service costs. 

He needs a loan to buy a machine that will be very useful in his shop, as he cannot afford to pay for it from his earnings. Luis dreams of building more rooms so that his house will be more comfortable and safer and he will have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is 41 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He has been raising cattle during the past years. He says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but his wife is helping him to raise the cattle, fatten them, and sell them in the market.

Izzat usually buys cattle, takes care of them by fattening them, and finally sells them in the market. His monthly income is 150 AZN. This financial income is the only source for the family. He plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan due its common use in everyday meals. 

Izzat is applying for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be his fourth loan with Aqroinvest. He believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, age 28, is a garment worker. She is unmarried and lives with her brother and sisters in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Sophea is requesting a loan in order to build a concrete brick room and to make essential repairs to the house where she lives.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room and to make essential repairs to the house where she lives with her brother and sisters

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is 28 years old. She is married and has a son whose name is Umed. Umed is three years old. Her husband is a migrant and works abroad. Nasiba lives with her son and her mother-in-law. 

Since her husband has a small income and her mother-in-law is an old woman, Nasiba decided to organize a business and find a source of income. So, two years ago, she began to own a business dealing with animal husbandry. Now, she is one of the best and most successful businesswomen in the local market. 

She buys cows, cares for them for two or three months, and sells them to local people. Thanks to her efforts, her cows are fat and they attract a lot of customers.
