Nasiba wants to buy a refrigerator for her household, but she does not have the money. It is very difficult for her to keep products in such hot weather without a refrigerator. She is asking for a loan of TJS 1,500 (somoni) to buy a refrigerator. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her household.

loans.name: Tuvshijargal

texts.en:
Mr.Tuvshinjargal is 23 years old and lives with his newly wedded wife in a small house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Uyanga, runs a small business, and helps her husband run their organic fruit plantation and sales business. 

Tuvshinjargal has been growing organic Sea Buckthorn trees and organic vegetables on their plot of land for years. Due to the harsh Mongolian weather, it is a seasonal business and he needs another source of generating money for the family. 

He is now requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase seedlings of Sea Buckthorns, as well as spare parts to fix his truck so he can run a transportation service business during the winter when production of trees and vegetables stops.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of Sea Buckthorns, and spare part to fix his truck to provide a transportation service business during winter when the growing season ends

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Chinzorig is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyun-Erdene, runs a small clothes retail business from a rental counter in a local market while she takes care of their new born baby daughter, Aminhuslen, age 1. 

Chinzorig has been providing an inter-city transportation service with his brother's van and getting paid since 2010. He has already built a close relationship with his clients. He is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a secondhand Russian van to start providing his own inter-city transportation service. He is a hardworking and energetic young man.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand Russian van to start providing his own inter-city transportation service

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas y telares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesania . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mantas y telares

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefina is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Kamer” which is located in the District of Coya, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. She is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children.

Josefina divides her time between her daily activities and managing her handicraft business. She sells blankets and looms. Josefina works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this business for four years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell handicrafts.

Josefina is requesting a loan in order to buy blankets and looms. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy blankets and looms.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha, age 44, is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru. She has been engaged in her farming business for the past 14 years. She lives with her husband and their three children, who are between the ages of eight and 18 years old.
 
She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. Her loan funds will enable her to buy farm inputs like seeds, chemicals, and fertilizers for use on her farmland.

Maritha hopes to continue with her farming enterprise as it has uplifted her living standards and has enabled her to provide employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, and fertilizers to use on her farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years of age and married. To support her family, she manages a hog-raising business in the village of Salvacion. For five years of doing this business, she was able to produce a breeding sow that gave birth to new piglets in almost a year, and she sells the piglets to buyers. Per piglet when sold is about PHP2,500. 

Aside from this, she also raises fattening pigs to sell every four months. To sustain her livestock growth and maintenance, she is requesting a loan of PHP22,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. Her hope now is to keep improving her business for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
This is Florencia, 59, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She already has grandchildren. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses and to help her children.

Florencia operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, in addition to other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Florencia dreams that her business will be successful so she can help her grandchildren in their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 44 years old and widowed with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Merlita has been in this business for 5 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Merlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, salt, eggs, noodles, spices and other groceries, etc. to sell.

 In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, salt, eggs, noodles, spices and other groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates the previous loan she received that enabled her to add more stock of firewood for her business. In addition she owns a clothing business, and she is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase more bales of clothes for her clothing business. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Edwin Gustavo

texts.es:
Edwin, está casado y vive con su familia, sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 3 y 6 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas y lo realiza de forma independiente de 6:00am a 4:00pm; la ventaja con la que cuenta es que tiene experiencia en el oficio porque lo aprendió en la escuela  y lo desempeña desde hace 22 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de herramientas para brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mayor utilidad en su negocio.
Su sueño es crear un buen record crediticio  y crecer más en su negocio, ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is married and lives with his family, his two children ages 3 and 6. He does not have relatives living abroad. He has a metal workshop, which he operates on his own from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00.p.m. His competitive advantage is that he studied this trade in school and has been practicing it for 22 years. 

He will use the loan to buy a variety of tools so that he can offer better customer service. The investment will help increase his profit. He wants to create a good credit history and offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: María a sus 56 años de edad es casada y no tiene hijos. Hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes con la cual ha generado ingresos para ayudar a su esposo a solventar las necesidades del hogar, pues a su edad no es factible conseguir oportunidades de empleo. La cliente es una persona activa, dinámica, emprendedora y pujante, trabaja largas jornadas diariamente para poder salir adelante. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (productos lácteos, gaseosas, mecato, galletería, confitería y productos de la canasta familiar en general) con esto podrá tener buena cantidad de productos disponibles para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. María sueña con tener su negocio más grande y ubicado en un lugar más comercial, que le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
María, 56, is married and has no children.

Two years ago she started her own business, a grocery store with which she has generated income to help her husband pay for the household necessities, because job opportunities aren't viable at her age.

She's an active, dynamic, enterprising, and thriving person.  She works long hours every day to be able to get ahead.

María's requesting the support of a loan to invest in buying stock (dairy products, soda, pastry, cookies, candy, and a variety of staples).  With this she'll have a good quantity of products available to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her sales and, as a result, her income.

María dreams of having a bigger business in a more commercial location so she and her husband can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es una persona con grandes metas y sueños, está luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia es por eso que está estudiando arduamente.
Le destaca que está poniendo todo de si, y esforzándose por poder sobresalir en sus estudios. Es un hombre muy luchador.
Hoy solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será muy provechosa para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ricardo's studying business administration.  He has big goals and dreams.  He's striving to improve his life and his family's, so he's studying hard.  He's putting everything into it and making the effort to get ahead in his studies.  He's a very persistent man.

Currently he's requesting this help so he can pay his university fees.

He's grateful for this opportunity because it'll be a big help to him and very useful to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es de la ciudad de Villarrica, comenta que su sueño se basa en cuando se reciba, pueda abrir un estudio contable para llevar la contabilidad de pequeñas, medianas y grandes empresa, ayudar a su familia en lo económico.
Su segundo logro seria tener un negocio propio de ramos generales, para generar fuentes de trabajo a los miembros de la familia y la comunidad en donde vive. Es una persona con grandes aspiraciones que quiere ir creciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de universidad.
texts.en:
Orlando's from the city of Villarrica.  He says is dream is to open an accounting business when he graduates so he can serve small, medium-size, and big businesses and help his family financially.

His second achievement would be to have his own general store to generate work for his family members and the community where he lives.  He's a person with big aspirations who wants to continue to grow.

He's grateful for this opportunity to continue studying.  He's requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Thais

texts.es:
Thais, de 20 años es una madre ejemplar vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanas junto a su pequeño hijo, en la casa donde nació. Desde pequeña cuidó con mucho esmero al ganado de su padre y hasta el día de hoy su mamá se dedica a este negocio, sin embargo Thair se dedica a la compra y venta de leche de calidad, un promedio de 300 litros diarios, los cuales comercializa para la elaboración de queso, yogurt y mantequilla. Le va muy bien en su negocio y para mas adelante desea incrementar la cantidad de leche que vende a la empresa elaboradora de productos lácteos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Thais, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de leche al por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Thais, 20, is an exemplary mother who lives with her parents, sisters and young son in the house where she was born. When she was little she worked tirelessly looking after her father's livestock, which her mother still does to this day. Thais however now works buying and selling milk, on average 300 litres a day, which she sells for making cheese, yoghurt and butter. Business is going well for her but she would like to increase the amount of milk she sells. This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support which will help her to get ahead. She promises to make her repayments in a timely manner. Thais will invest the 1,000 soles in buying wholesale milk to stock up her business.

loans.use: To buy wholesale milk.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat (in the photo), age 30, buys and sells fish in the local market. His wife is a garment worker. He has two children, one son and one daughter. Both of his children are in school. He lives with his parents in a village about 40 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phat is asking for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan (in the photo), age 57, is a widow. She has nine children - six sons and three daughters. One is married, three are garment workers and two are in school. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phan hopes to expand her land property by purchasing neighboring land, but she does not have money, so she decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase neighboring land to expand her property

loans.name: Manuel Javier

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con la familia la cual está formada por su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la venta de huevos negocio que lo aprendió cuando el trabajo en una comercial, luego decidió independizarse y es por eso que desde hace un año trabaja por su cuenta desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 
Con este crédito Manuel pretende, invertir en la compra de huevos para poder venderlos a otro precio y así obtener  más utilidades y mayores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Manuel tiene un sueño y espera un día poder cumplirlo y es tener un vehículo propio para poder distribuir la mercadería e ir a otros lugares a vender huevos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and children. He works selling eggs, a business he learned when he worked in a store. Later he decided to work independently and for this reason he has been working on his own for a year from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

With this loan, Manuel hopes to invest in the purchase of eggs to resell them and thereby get more utilities and higher profits to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Manuel has a dream he hopes to realize one day. It is to have his own vehicle to distribute merchandise and sell eggs in other places.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to resell at a different price.

loans.name: Nilma Liseth

texts.es:
Nilma, es una persona casada y vive solamente con su hija, la cual depende de ella. La Sra. Nilma se dedica a la crianza de ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende, dicha actividad la realiza gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres, lo desempeña en horarios de 6:00am a 10:00am y 2:00pm a 5:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar dos vacas paridas para la producción de leche; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener materia prima y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
Su sueño es tener su ganadería en producción y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nilma is married and lives with her dependent daughter. Nilma raises cows and sells their milk, a trade she learned from her parents. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. and from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.

She has applied for a loan to buy two calves to produce milk, an investment that will increase her supply and satisfy customer demand. She dreams of having a herd to produce milk and offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy two calves to produce milk.

loans.name: Mwenii

texts.en:
Mwenii is a married woman and has four children, one who attends school and the rest have completed. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, coconuts, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, coconuts, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a broader range of items to sell in her store, such as soft drinks, canned goods, snacks, beverages, seasonings, eggs, detergents, and frozen foods

loans.name: Petonela

texts.en:
A $1,200 loan is offered to Petronela to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like rice, sugar, coffee, milks, eggs, soap, noodles, oils and slippers. She is generating a good income from selling.  She has been thinking of running a big business for the future. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, milks, eggs, soap, noodles and oils

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es:
Jeanette es madre de dos hijos, la familia alquila una casa en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente tiene una movilidad con la cual genera sus ingresos haciéndola trabajar en el transporte público, pero por las noches ha comenzado a vender hamburguesas en la puerta de su casa para aumentar sus ingresos y poder mantener a sus hijos. Necesita crédito para comprar llantas y un motor para el vehículo que le proporciona una renta diaria
texts.en: Jeanette is the mother of two children, and the family rents a house in the city of La Paz. She owns a vehicle, which she uses to earn income by offering transportation service. She also started selling hamburgers from her doorway to increase her earnings and support her children. She needs a loan to buy an engine and tires for her vehicle, which provides daily income.

loans.use: to buy an engine and tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is very thankful for the loan lent to her. It helped a lot in her businesses as well as in the family's everyday expenses. She no longer has a variety store, but she still has a piggery, a food stall, and a bakery. She still works hard to provide for her everyday needs.  

Alicia would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy additional hogs and feed needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia hopes that all her businesses will flourish and she dreams to always be in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig, age 31, offers transportation services to earn an income. He lives with his wife Surenhuu, who recently gave birth to their daughter Haliun, now eight months old, and their daughter Hulan, who goes to kindergarten. The family lives in a "ger" (a traditional Mongolian family tent dwelling) in the Tolgoit area of the capital city of Ulaanbaatar.

Ganzorig is an enthusiastic, talkative, and hard-working man who has been running his transportation services business for years. He has been placing some of his profits into savings for some time with the goal of purchasing a second-vehicle so that he can start to offer taxi services. He needs this additional business income as soon as possible in order to cover the recent increase in family expenses, since they have a newborn baby and his wife is not working. 

In order to allow him to purchase the taxi vehicle as soon as possible, Ganzorig is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 MNT. He will use his loan funds to purchase the vehicle and to start providing taxi services.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle so that he can start providing taxi services

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, decide optar un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo  para mejorar su negocio de venta de comida; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar dos mesas de madera y sillas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su negocio y con ello brindo una mayor satisfacción a los clientes, gracias al financiamiento la Sra. Isabel logro separar el negocio de su casa de habitación, por lo que hoy en día la cocina esta aparte.
texts.en: Isabel decided to apply for another loan because she needs capital to renovate her food business by buying two wood tables and chairs. The previous credit helped her make improvements and offer better customer service. Thanks to the loan, Isabel was able to set up her business kitchen away from her house.

loans.use: to buy two wood tables and chairs.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto, con 28 años de edad es padre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace varios años inició su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa para dama, ubicado en un sector muy comercial y en el cual existe gran cantidad de competidores. Esta idea de negocio nace de la necesidad de conseguir recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia, pues han pasado por muchas dificultades económicas debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo. Edilberto es un hombre juicioso, activo, emprendedor y dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Trabaja arduas jornadas diariamente, pues abre desde las 9:00 m y hasta las 9:00 pm con el fin de aprovechar al máximo el tiempo para que lleguen los posibles clientes. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, shorts) y realizar unas adecuaciones locativas, esto le permitirá brindar una mejor imagen a su negocio y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes para satisfacer sus necesidades y gustos, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de los ingresos por ventas. De esta manera, Edilberto pretende acreditar su negocio y avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su meta, que es montar otro almacén y generar más ingresos que le ayuden a brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 28, is the father of a son.  He lives with his partner in a common-law relationship.

Several years ago he started his own business, a women's clothing store located in a very commercial area where there's a lot of competition.  This business idea came from his need to earn income to support his family, which has gone through financial difficulties because of the lack of job opportunities.

Edilberto's a sensible, active, and enterprising man who's devoted to his family and his job.  He works an arduous schedule every day, opening from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. so he can make the most of the time to serve potential customers.

He's requesting the current loan to buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, shorts) and to make some modifications to his store.  This will allow him to improve the appearance of his business and sell a greater variety of products to his customers to satisfy their needs and tastes, thus increasing his sales.

Edilberto hopes to gain recognition for his business and make progress toward achieving his goal of setting up another department store and generating more income to give his son a better education and to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale and to modify his store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam esta casada tiene dos hijos vive en casa de su cuñado no paga mucho alquiler en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

Miriam, se dedica a la venta de maní que luego ella procesa para comercializarlo en mercados de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza desde que era joven y rinde bastante bien ya que mantiene a su familia.Necesita crédito para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad  Miriam desea comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has two children. She lives in her brother-in-law’s house in the Pasankeri neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She doesn’t pay much rent.

For a living, Miriam sells peanuts that she processes in order to sell them at markets in the city. She has done this activity since she was young and it does quite well since it supports her family. She is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients. Miriam wants to purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business selling processed peanuts.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene tres hijos, la familia alquila una casa en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como chófer de transporte publico. Necesita crédito para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehiculo, un servicio que él requiere con urgencia. Edgar no ha desistido de tener casa propia en un futuro cercano
texts.en: Edgar has three children, and his family rents a house in the city of La Paz. He drives a taxi and urgently needs to pay for vehicle maintenance. Edgar stills hopes to have his own house soon.

loans.use: to do vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume and underwear

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a barbecue vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rachele

texts.en:
Rachele is 44 years old, married with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rachele has a business grinding coconuts  in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her grinding machine and to buy additional old coconut fruits.

Rachele has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her grinding machine and to buy additional old coconut fruits

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman and has one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Usaphea

texts.en:
Usaphea, age 27, is a garment worker. Her husband is a security guard. For additional income, the couple also grows rice during the rice season. They have been married since 2011 and have one young daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
  
Usaphea is asking for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle to use to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use to get to work

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en:
Sreyda (in the photo), age 22, is single. She lives with her widowed mother and brother and sister in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is a farmer. 

Sreyda’s sister, who is married, wants to live in a separate home. Hence, Sreyda decided to apply for a loan to help get money for her sister to build her own house to live in.

loans.use: To get money for her sister to build her own house to live in.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo, de 45 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de sus 6 hijos a los que educa y cría en la casa que compró hace 8 años. Por los constantes gastos que posee se dedica a diversas actividades económicas. Su principal ingreso lo obtiene de su oficio de albañil, comenta que tiene contratos para la construcción de casas de manera permanente y nunca le falta trabajo por lo que desea adquirir más herramientas para su construcción. Mientras que los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, además su hijo mayor tiene un mototaxi con el cual tambien obtiene buenas ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Alfredo, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de herramientas de construcción.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 45, is a responsible man.  He lives with his six children, whom he educates and raises in the house he bought eight years ago.  He earns a living doing a variety of jobs because of his constant expenses.

He earns his main income from his job as a bricklayer.  He says he has contracts to build houses on a permanent basis and he never lacks work.  For this reason he wants to buy more construction tools.

On the weekends he buys and sells animals.  Also, his oldest son has a motorcycle taxi and also earns a good profit.

This is his first Kiva loan and he's grateful for the financial help to get ahead.  He also promises to make his payments punctually.

Alfredo will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in construction tools.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She is residing harmoniously, together with her family, in the village of Sampaguita. 

Josephine raises hogs to sell. She usually gains a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. She would like to improve the growth and nutrition of hogs. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustainability.

Josephine hopes to keep maintaining her hog-raising business and to become a successful hog-raiser someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustainability.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Yasmeen, as a member of four, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Yasmeen is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet resides in the Nkubu region of Eastern Kenya, a fertile area good for investing in agriculture production located at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has four children, three of whom are of school going age. She has been practicing farming for twenty years. Her source of income is horticultural crops and milk. She wants to construct a zero grazing unit, and she wants financing for it, so she has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 50,000. This loan will enable her dairy animals to feed better and increase milk production, thus increasing income. This will help her educate her children with ease and also improve their living standards.

Janet says that in five years time she wants to have over 2,000 dairy animals.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a wise woman who is engaged in a retail business. She has two children currently attending school. Evelyn’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in their field. She admits the fact that she still has no additional business yet as a source of extra income, so she has this difficulty in providing their children's needs.

Now in her store, Evelyn sells spices, canned goods and various groceries in their village. Some of her income from the business was invested in their farming and improvement of the business she is engaged in. She is asking for the loan of PHP 30,000 to buy different merchandise like noodles. eggs, bread, and more. She will also use some of the loan to buy fresh fish, meat and vegetables as additional items to sell. She looks forward to prospering with the business that she has now.

loans.use: to buy different merchandise like noodles. eggs, bread, and more and to buy fresh fish, meat and vegetables as additional items to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah Mukwanyaga

texts.en: Lydiah is a hard-working mother of three and widow from Eastern Kenya. She practices dairy farming and owns seven cows, which produce 45 liters of milk per day. Income from her milk sales is shared among her many financial responsibilities, including paying school fees for her children. She has also been using a big portion of this income to purchase fuel, and after being advised by VEP on how to save this amount of money, she opted for a biodigester to save on her day-to-day fuel costs. With a biodigester, Lydiah will be able to save money previously spent on charcoal, kerosene, and firewood. Time spent on firewood collection will also be saved, enabling her to spend more time with her family. The biodigester will also help promote a clean environment.

loans.use: to build a biodigester

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Venus has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business making bread.

Venus has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es taxista y vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Necesita crédito para comprar una caja de cambios para su automovil pues la que tiene  esta severamente dañada, como Ricardo percibe ingresos diarios, un día que no trabaja no puede costear sus gastos de sobrevivencia. Ricardo sueña con tener casa propia
texts.en: Ricardo is a taxi driver who lives in the city of La Paz. He needs a loan to buy a car transmission because the current one is badly damaged. Ricardo earns money daily, and he would not be able to meet basic living expenses if he missed a day of work. He dreams of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy a transmission for his vehicle.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel  esta empleado como Asesor de Seguros, es uno de los pocos clientes que cuentan con un nivel de educación superior, tiene casa propia y vive en la ciudad de La Paz. No obstante, su sueldo no es alto y su trabajo es bastante demandante, además, necesita crédito para tomar un curso de especialización en materia de seguros, puesto que sus gastos de manutención no le dejan invertir por su cuenta en su educación
texts.en: Angel is employed as an Insurance Adviser.  He is one of the few clients who has a higher education.  He has his own house and lives in the city of La Paz.  Nevertheless, his salary is not high and his work is quite demanding.  Also, he needs the loan to take a course specializing in insurance, since his costs of living do not allow him to pay for his education on his own.

loans.use: to pay for a course specializing in insurance.

loans.name: Ambari

texts.en:
Ambari is married, with two children, one of whom goes to school. They own a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ambari has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Ambari wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 43 años, vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 2 últimos hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Gladys se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y maíz, en los terrenos que heredó de su padre. Como es una mujer soltera, puede viajar a otras ciudades, para comercializar sus cosechas y quedarse días, esperando obtener una buena ganancia. Asimismo vende animales en la feria que se desarrolla en una ciudad cercana a su vivienda. Ahora tiene 7 vacas, que recién adquirió y de las que realiza queso o vende leche a una empresa lechera de su zona, depende al precio de venta, afirma. “cuanto más me paguen mejor”. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Gladys, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Glady is 43 years old and lives with her parents and her 2 youngest brothers who she takes care of in their own house. Gladys works growing potatoes, beans, and corn on land that she inherited from her father. As she is single, she can travel to other cities to sell the products obtained from the harvest and can stay there for a few days to get a good profit. She also sells animals at the fair which takes place in a nearby city. She now has 7 cows, which she bought recently, and she uses them to produce cheese or milk which she sells to a dairy company in her area. The price she gets for it depends, she says, “the more they pay me the better.” This is her second loan from Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to be able to move forward. Moreover, she is committed to making timely repayments. Gladys will invest the 600 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish the crops in her fields

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es soltero, no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de su mamà, el domicilio esta en la ciudad de El Alto.
Mario sólo pudo estudiar hasta la primaria, actualmente trabaja en un taller de chaperia de lunes a viernes 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una compresora y un tanque de oxigeno. El desea independisarse y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener su propio taller de chaperia
texts.en: Mario is single and has no children. He lives in his mother's house in the city of El Alto. Mario was only able to finish elementary school. He works in an auto repair shop from Monday to Friday. He needs a loan to buy a compressor and oxygen tank. He wants to be independent, improve his standard of living, and have his own auto repair shop.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and oxygen tank.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 51 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Antonio, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. A pesar de su edad, ellos continúan trabajando en la agricultura, desde muy niña comenzó en el cuidado de la tierra, “nací, crecí y moriré en la tierra”, comenta. Posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas y desde hace 30 años, comenzó a sembrar de manera independiente sus propios alimentos, los que consisten en papa, olluco, alverja y habas en grandes cantidades, junto a su esposo cuidan de los sembríos, fertilizando y limpiando la maleza que crece entre los surcos, ya en cada cosecha en compañía de su menor hijo, comercializan los alimentos a la ciudad de Pampas, “llevo a mi hijo para que cuente el dinero y me ayude en la negociación”, comenta. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus sembríos para tener alimentos de calidad. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido ya que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Teodora, invertirá S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Teodora, 51, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Antonio, with whom she has five children. Only one of the children lives with them in the house she inherited from her parents. Despite her age, she still farms, as she has done from an early age. "I was born, grew up, and will die on the land," she says. 

Teodora has owned her land for 30 years and she grows her food--potatoes, olluco, vetch, and beans--in large quantities. She and her husband care for the crops, fertilizing and clearing the weeds that grow in the furrows. Their youngest son helps with the harvest, which they sell in the city of  Pampas. “I take my son along to help with the bargaining," she says. 

She wants to improve her plantings so that she produces quality crops. This is her second loan cycle with KIVA, and she is grateful for the funding, which lets her get ahead. She promises to make her payments on time. Teodora will use the 1500 soles to buy organic manure for her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a 41-year-old, married woman, from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children.The oldest is 20, while the youngest is 10. 

She engages in a retail business. She sells personal collection products, like cologne and apparel, and beauty products, like whitening lotion and face powder. Aside from retail, she also makes snack foods and sells them to nearby schools, to augment additional income. 

Ma. Victoria requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks, like body spray, soaps, and other beauty products, to meet customers' demands. 

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to expand both her businesses to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food-vending and to purchase stocks, like body spray, soaps, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 22 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde pequeña aprendió todo lo necesario de la agricultura desde entonces dedicó todo su esfuerzo en mejorar sus aprendizaje, hoy posee terrenos que le fueron heredados por sus padres en donde siembra verduras de buenas calidad, pero como la cosecha es constantes ella pensó en comenzar el negocio de compra y venta de verduras en la selva del país donde viaja cada fin de semana, para ello necesita de bastante mercadería y siempre compra las diversas cosechas de sus vecinos agricultores como ella, en temporada de cosecha comercializa sus propios sembríos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Rocío, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de verduras al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocío is 22 and an unassuming woman. She lives with her small son in their own home. From a young age she learned everything necessary about agriculture and since then has devoted all her effort to improving her knowledge. Today she has parcels of land that she inherited from her parents, where she grows good-quality vegetables. 

But as the harvest is constant, she thought of starting a business buying and selling vegetables in the forest areas of the country where she travels every weekend. For this she needs enough merchandise and always buys the various crops of her neighbors, who are farmers like her. At harvest season she sells her own crops. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial assistance she is receiving to move forward.  In addition, she promises to make her installment payments on time. Rocio will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of vegetables at wholesale for her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Zolorina

texts.en:
Zolorina is applying for a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, soap, salt, bread, cigarettes, fish canes and oil. She makes good money from sales and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Zolorina is living in a town near the school, so her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to shop including students.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, soap, salt, bread and cigarettes

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie busies herself with her business of selling snacks in the community. The meager income of PHP 1500 per month has supported her family of four. At 64, this serves as her hobby while making income in their locality of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines where she lives. Nellie has reached out to PMPC for additional capital to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and butter.

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva esta casada, tiene domicilio propio en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz.
La actividad que realiza es la elaboración de dulces de sahumerio, usados para rituales bolivianos que sirven para bendecir las casas y los negocios de las personas, una costumbre milenaria de Bolivia. Necesita credito para comprar insumos y continuar con el negocio. Por si acaso, los dulces de sahumerio no son comestibles, sirven para la combustión en fogatas ceremoniales que la Iglesia Catolica aprueba en Bolivia
texts.en:
Eva's married and has her own home in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz.

Eva's job is making incense candies used in Bolivian rituals for blessing people's homes and businesses, a millennial tradition in Bolivia.

She needs a loan to buy supplies to continue with her business.

For the record, the candies are not edible.  They serve as combustion in ceremonial bonfires approved by the Catholic Church in Bolivia.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es soltero  vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió hasta la secundaria, trabaja como chofer, es socio propietario del negocio y esta afiliado a un sindicato. Necesita crédito para comprar un tanque de gas natural, porque la gasolina es más cara. Ramiro desea comprar otra movilidad a futuro y mejorar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Ramiro is single.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.  He attended school up until high school, and he works as a driver.  He owns his business, and he is affiliated with a union.

He needs the loan to buy a tank of natural gas because gasoline is more expensive.  Ramiro wishes to buy another vehicle in the future, and he wishes to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a tank of natural gas for his automobile.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 55 años, está casada con Feliciano, con quien tiene 9 hijos. Pero solo vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia. Como buena madre, se preocupa por el estudio de sus hijos, los cuales estudian educación superior en otra ciudad; proporcionándoles dinero mensualmente. Carmen se dedica a la siembra de papa, alverja y maíz, en sus terrenos propios, ubicados en la zona alta de su localidad, donde tiene agua a su disposición. Según menciona en sus 15 años de experiencia, tiene gran éxito vendiendo a los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado mayorista de su localidad. Asimismo, se dedica a la crianza de animales como: carneros, vacas y toros. Los cuales le ayudan a labrar la tierra, como también a incursionar en la venta de carne, a los vecinos y carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Carmen, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 55, is married to Feliciano, and together they have 9 children.  She lives with 4 of her children in her own home.  As a good mother, Carmen is concerned about her children's education.  She has children attending college in another city, and she provides them with a monthly stipend.  

Carmen is a farmer who cultivates potatoes, peas and corn on her own land, located in the upper area of her town where there is water available.  She states that in her 15 years of experience, she has had great success selling to the wholesale traders who sell in the wholesale market in her town.  In addition, she raises animals such as: sheep, cows and bulls that help her to work the land.  She also sells meat to her neighbors and to the butchers who frequently visit her.  

This is Carmen's 4th loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving that will allow her to continue forward.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Carmen will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is receiving in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es soltero y vive en un cuarto en alquiler en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. El señor es taxista y trabaja mas de 12 horas al día para poder cubrir con sus gastos diarios. El señor requiere el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo ya que sufrio un accidente y no cuenta con los recursos para poder cubrir esos gastos.

El sueño de Mario es poder ahorrar dinero y, con el tiempo, poder tener un negocio que le permita crecer económicamente.
texts.en: Mario is single and lives in a rented room in Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. He works more than 12 hours each day driving a taxi to pay his living expenses. He needs a loan to repair his taxi, which was damaged in an accident, because he doesn't have enough money to cover the cost. Mario hopes to save money to have a business that will improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is married, with seven children who are school-aged. She is 43 years old and lives in Candura, San Juan, Siquijor. 

Mely is engaged in a hog-raising activity to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase additional piglets and feed. 

Mely is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, Mely hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 53-year-old female with two children.

Adela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase an  additional stock of household goods to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc..

Adela has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling seafood.

Adela aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business selling food stuff of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge.

Riziki dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 23 años es un joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Desde joven apoyó a sus padres en el cuidado de sus sembríos, por eso ahora se dedica a la agricultura y posee extensiones de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra alverja, papa y demás tubérculos. Gracias a su buen juicio en el negocio pudo comprar su propio auto con el que realiza trasporte, pero como es un joven muy trabajador se da un tiempo para poder cuidar de sus cultivos y los fines de semana invierte todo su tiempo en el cuidado de los mismos. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y se encuentra proyectando sus planes en la siembra de alverja, ya que el precio en el mercado es muy bueno. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Juan, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 and responsible. He lives with his siblings in his parent's house. From an early age, he helped his parents raise crops, so he also farms and owns crop land, where he plants vetch, potatoes, and root vegetables. He business success let him buy a car, which he uses for transport service. Being a hard worker gives him time to tend his crops, and he spends his weekends doing so. 

Juan wants to earn more and plans to grow more vetch while the market price is high. This is his second loan cycle with Kiva. Juan will use the 1000 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 39 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales solo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. A pesar de la lucha constante que tiene que hacer sola; ella saca fuerzas para continuar trabajando. Vilma se dedica es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en la siembra de alverja, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente. Según cuenta, lo que más le gusta de su labor es poder pasar tiempo en el campo, “me gusta la paz que encuentro”, afirma. Además de aprovechar y cuidar a sus animales como vacas y toros, los que cría al mismo tiempo que cuida de sus cultivos. Además de aprovechar la leche que le proporciona para realizar moldes de queso que vende a los pobladores de su zona. Su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, motivo por el cual hace poco cerró su tienda de comestibles. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Vilma, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 39, is the courageous single mother of four children.  She lives in her own house with two of her children.  In spite of the constant struggle that she has to make by herself, she draws upon her strength to continue working.

Vilma is a farmer.  She has 20 years of experience growing peas, corn, and potatoes.  She cares for them continuously.  She says that what she likes the most about her work is being able to spend time in the field.  “I like the peace that I find,” she asserts.  She also benefits by taking care of her animals like cows and bulls.  She takes care of them at the same time that she cares for her crops.  She takes advantage of the milk that they provide in order to make cheese molds that she sells to the inhabitants in her area.

Her greatest difficulty is the lack of working capital.  That is why, a little while ago, she closed her food store.  This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support that she is getting in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Vilma will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, de 33 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ángel con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 15 años. Desde pequeña se dedica a la agricultura, por eso hoy posee terrenos que le fueron heredados por sus padres en donde siembra verduras de buenas calidad, pero como la cosecha es constantes ella pensó en comenzar el negocio de compra y venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad gracias a las negociaciones que tuvo con los dirigentes cuenta con un puesto fijo donde vende 3 veces a la semana en días de feria, para ello necesita de bastante mercadería y siempre compra las diversas cosechas de sus vecinos agricultores. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Magdalena, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de hortalizas para su venta.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 33, is a modest woman. She lives with her husband, Ángel, with whom she has three children who live with them in the house they bought 15 years ago. She has been farming since childhood. She inherited land from her parents, where she grows quality vegetables. 

Harvesting is continuous, so she decided to start a business selling vegetables in the local market. She negotiated with the owners for a fixed stand, where she sells her products three times a week on holidays. She needs a lot of merchandise and always buys different crops from neighboring growers.

This is her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to go forward. She promises to make her payments on time. Magdalena will use the 1000 soles to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sharifmoh

texts.ru: Шарифмох замужняя женщина в возрасте 43-х лет. Она проживает с мужем и детьми в районе Яван. У нее двое дочерей и двое сыновей. Ее муж работает кассиром в одной организации. Шарифмох тоже наравне с мужем имеет свой вклад в обеспечении семьи. Она занимается животноводческим бизнесом. Шарифмох в течение 6 лет закупает крупнорогатый скот с целью откорма и перепродажи. Она разводит скот на местном пастбище. Ей помогает семья. Шарифмох сейчас просит кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и продвинуть деятельность. На сумму кредита она хочет закупить коров и телят, а также корм. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Sharifmoh is a married woman of 43 years. She lives with her husband and children in the Yavan region. She has two daughters and two sons. Her husband works as a cashier in an organization. 

Along with her husband, Sharifmoh also has contributed to supporting the family. She is engaged in raising livestock. For six years, Sharifmoh has been buying cattle for fattening and resale. She tends the livestock in a local pasture. She helps the family. 

Sharifmoh is now requesting a loan in order to increase her livestock count and to promote activities. With the loan amount, she wants to buy cows and calves, as well as their feed. She is awaiting support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and their feed for developing a business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 20 years old and he, along with his mother and brother, lives in the village of Gugarq, which is in the Lori region. Edgar has no higher education, but nevertheless, he manages to earn a living since he is a bread-winner in his family. 

Edgar works as a pizza backer at the pizzeria. Edgar has a shift work and, in his free time off from his work, he has established his own business. At home he makes pizza dough and he sells it to the local food markets. He has been engaged in this business for only a year. He is thinking of becoming more professional in this field since the specialty of cooking is something he has liked very much since he was a little boy.

Edgar asks for a loan of AMD 300,000 (Armenian drams) to buy a computer to gather a lot of information connected with his work, to find out all the secrets connected with pizza and its dough.

loans.use: to buy a computer to gather a lot of information connected with his work.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. He has been a farmer for thirty years. His sources of income are cereals and horticultural crops.

He wants to expand his farm by doing poultry farming. He has requested a loan of KES 70,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to undertake that project. This will cause there to be an increase in income because of egg production and chicken meat. This will help him educate his children better and improve their living standards. The challenges he faces are pests and diseases, and insufficient funds.

In five years, he wants to have over 5,000 poultry, both layers and broilers, at his farm. Andrew says that he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for funding him in his project.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and she has three children. Lucia has been helping her husband in tilling their farm. This is the source of their income.

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. Lucia dreams of expanding their farm, so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own work. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, and cigarettes. She is generating a good income from selling. 

Maria has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Maria is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, milk and cigarettes.

loans.name: Rocha

texts.pt:
Rocha nasceu na Província de Tete e tem 43 anos. É pai de 2 filhos que vão à escola e responsabiliza-se também pelos seus 4 netos que também vivem com ele em sua casa.
É segurança há mais de 10 anos e aplica o seu salário nas despesas da casa e na construção da sua nova casa. Com o valor do empréstimo pretende dar continuidade à sua obra adquirindo materiais de construção como cimento, chapas de zinco e barrotes. Este é seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku e o anterior foi usado para a mesma finalidade.
Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para iniciar com a construção do muro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Rocha was born in the province of Tete and is 43 years old. He has two children who go to school and is also responsible for his four grandchildren, who also live with him in his house.
He has been a security guard for more than 10 years and uses his salary for household expenses and in building his new house. He plans to use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, sheet metal, beams, etc.). This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and the previous loan was also used for this purpose.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan early and request a new one in order to start building a boundary wall for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sheet metal, beams, etc.) to continue building his house.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
António nasceu na Província de Inhambane e tem 35 anos. É casado e pai de 3 filhos que vão à escola.
Trabalha no Conselho Municipal como segurança há mais de 4 anos, tendo um salário que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra (está a construir uma casa para si e para a sua família). Pretende com o valor do empréstimo dar continuidade à sua obra, adquirindo materiais de construção como cimento, blocos, ferros e aros da janela. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku para habitação.
Pretende futuramente iniciar a construção de uma capoeira na sua casa para criação de pintos e patos.
texts.en:
António was born in the province of Inhambane and is 35 years old. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom attend school.
He has worked as a security guard at the town hall for more than four years and uses his salary to cover his household expenses and to build a house for himself and his family. He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) to continue the work on his house. This is his third home construction loan from Hluvuku.
In the future he plans to start building a coop at his house to raise chickens and ducks.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, rebar, etc.) to continue the work on his house.

loans.name: Revulino

texts.pt:
Revulino nasceu na Província de Gaza, no Sul de Moçambique. Tem 30 anos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e é pai de 1 filho que vai à escola. Responsabiliza-se também pela sobrinha que vive com ele em sua casa.
É funcionário do Conselho Municipal (é polícia) e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra, pois está a construir uma casa para si e para a sua família. Mas como o custo de vida eleva-se a cada dia que passa, ele solicitou um empréstimo para concluir as mínimas partes da sua obra. Este é já o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku, e os 2 anteriores foram também para habitação.
Futuramente pretende concluir o empréstimo para aceder a outro e plantar um lindo jardim no quintal da sua casa.
texts.en:
Revulino was born in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is 30 years old and lives with his family in a home they own. He has one school-aged son and also takes care of a niece who lives with him.
He works for the city as a policeman and uses his income to cover household expenses and in building a house for himself and his family. But the cost of living is increasing every day, so he is requesting a loan to finish part of the construction. This is his third loan with Hluvuku; he used the two previous loans for the house, too.
In the future he plans to pay off this loan so he can take out another to plant a beautiful garden outside his house.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 52 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha appreciates the previous loans she received from Kiva that enabled her to renovate her rental house and attract more tenants, thereby increasing her profit margin. Having joined Yehu for financial support, she is now requesting a loan of Ksh.40,000 to purchase iron sheets and building materials to complete her rental house.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and building materials to complete her rental house.

loans.name: Ester Gladys

texts.es: Ester, a sus 58 años de edad es separada y madre de 2 hijos. Después de pasar por una situación emocional muy difícil, debido al abandono de su esposo y en vista de que toda la carga económica de su hogar recayó sobre ella, Ester buscó opciones para generar ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de su casa y, desde hace 6 años se dedica a vender mecato, confitería, cigarrillos y minutos a celular en una chaza, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante. Con esto ha logrado suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia. La cliente es una mujer emprendedora, amable, dinámica y trabajadora, labora largas jornadas diarias de Lunes a Domingo, con el fin de aprovechar al máximo la ubicación de su chaza, pues está en una calle principal del municipio donde reside, por lo que es muy transitada. Actualmente solicita su séptimo ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el arreglo de la chaza, comprar surtido (mecato, galletas, confites, cigarrillos) y pagar el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente. Esto le permitirá darle una mejor imagen a su negocio que sea agradable a la vista de los transeúntes y además podrá tener surtido suficiente para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, aumentando así sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Ester sueña con fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo crecer, para que le dé la oportunidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida al lado de sus hijos.
texts.en: Ester is 58 years old, separated, and the mother of two children.  Following  a very difficult emotional situation when her husband left her and having all the financial responsibilities fall on her, she looked for income opportunities to be able to pay her household expenses and has been selling pastries, sweets, cigarettes, and cell phone cards on foot for the past six years.  This has allowed her to provide her family with their basic needs.  She is a very enterprising, friendly, dynamic, and hard working woman who works long shifts Monday  through Sunday so she can take maximum advantage of her stall, since it’s located on a well-travelled main street in the city where she lives.  She is asking for this seventh loan which she will use to fix up her stall, buy stock (pastries, cookies, candy, cigarettes) and pay off the other loan she has.  This will allow her to improve her business’ image to the passersby and also to have enough inventory to satisfy her customers’ desires.  This will increase her sales and income.  Ester dreams of strengthening and growing her business so that she will have the chance to enjoy a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: to fix up her stall and buy inventory.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel, a 34-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for six years and also earns income from selling generic medicine and farming vegetables.

Having borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF, Mirabel has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to buy items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, liquor, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, liquor, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 56 años; está casado con Felicia, con quien tiene una hija, juntos viven en la casa de sus suegros. Arturo se dedica a la agricultura, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas cultiva no solo hortalizas de toda variedad también tubérculos, pues las tierras que posee tienen riego y son muy fértiles por lo que no tiene inconvenientes y en cada cosecha comercializa sus sembríos a buen precio en el mercado da su ciudad. Comenta que gracias a sus ganancias, hoy en día posee terrenos agrícolas en otros lugares de la ciudad cerca de la carretera por lo que espera en esta cosecha tener un ingreso extra. Ahora se encuentra preparándose para la temporada de siembra pues el tiempo es propicio. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Arturo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Arturo is 56 years old and married to Felicia with whom he has a daughter. They live together in his in-laws' house. Arturo is a farmer, working his own agricultural fields. He cultivates not only vegetables of all varieties but also tubers. His fields are irrigated and very fertile, and as a result, he has no problems. Following each harvest, he sells his products at a good price in the city market.  

Arturo comments that thanks to his earnings, today he also possesses agricultural lands in other parts of the city close to the highway. For that reason, with this harvest he expects to earn extra income. At present, he is preparing for the sowing season and the time is propitious. 

This is Arturo's 5th loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial help he receives to continue ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments in a punctual manner. Arturo will invest the 3,000 sols in purchasing organic manure to fertilize his plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.name: Sol De Vino Tinto * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SOL DE VINO TINTO * 26, Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete  mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Lourdes  tiene 47 años, casado con dos hijos de las edades de  8 y 13 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lourdes  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que está haciendo construir su  casita   y  de esta manera brindar comodidad a su familia  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar su calidad de vida,   la Sra. Lourdes  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sol de Vino Tinto*26” consists of nine members, seven women and two women.

The bank president is Sra. Lourdes. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children (ages 8 and 13). Lourdes sells a variety of soft drinks from a vending post located at one of the busiest markets in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender. Sra. Lourdes will use the money to buy construction materials for building her small home. This will provide comfort for her family. Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve her quality of life.

Sra. Lourdes is a hardworking person who is pleased with the opportunity that has been given.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie, a 47-year-old single man, lives in Candura, San Juan, Siquijor, where he has been selling a variety of products to earn a living for two years, earning PHP 4,000.00 each month. He has requested a loan for PHP 14,000.00 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Romie has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, he hopes to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and farming vegetables.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 25000 to buy additional household goods to sell such as sugar, soap, shampoo, coffee, charcoal, etc. for her general store business.

Julieta hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell such as sugar, soap, shampoo, coffee, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.es:
señor Valeriano tiene 38 años de edad es originario de Chiapas, tiene ya mas de 20 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, en donde se caso con la señora Francisca con quien tiene cuatro hijos de edad escolar. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que a su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la instalación eléctrica, porque la que tiene esta en muy malas condiciones  y quiere prevenir una accidente pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario y para realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible ya que sus hijos le esta haciendo falta la luz en la casa. 
El señor Valeriano tiene ya mas de 10 años dedicándose a la carpintería el tiene su negocio en su casa para así poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos ya que su esposa se dedica a la venta de dulces, refrescos y artesanías en el centro de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
