Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de carpintería es para pagar el crédito y que con el ingreso del negocio de su esposa es para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desean mejorar y acondicionar el patrimonio de sus hijos y que tengan un lugar seguro y con las comodidades necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Valeriano is 38 years old and comes from Chiapas. He has been located in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 20 years, where he married Francisca with whom he has four school-age children.

He is applying for a loan because he needs to do electrical installations at home, since the ones they have are in very poor condition and he wants to avoid an accident. However, for the time being he doesn't have the money needed for making this improvement. He needs to do it as soon as possible since his children are in the need of light at home.

Valeriano has worked as a carpenter for more than 10 years and his business is in his home so that he can watch over his children. His wife sells sweets, soft drinks, and handicrafts in the center of Nuevo Laredo.

The profits he makes from his carpentry business go to paying back the loan and the profits from his wife's business go to paying the expenses of the household and schooling. They want to improve the heritage of their children and give them a safe place with the amenities necessary for their development.

loans.use: to make electrical installations

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara vive sola en la zona 1º de Mayo de la ciudad de El Alto. Se dedica a la compaginacion de textos en una imprenta. Sara estudia en la carrera de Sociologia, necesita el credito para culminar sus estudios.

El sueño de Sara es poder culminar sus estudios, ejercer su profesion y asi poder brindar apoyo a su familia que se encuentra dispersa en distintas partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sara lives alone in the “1º de Mayo” zone of the city of El Alto.  She does text layouts for a printer and also studies sociology.  She needs this loan to finish her studies.

Sara’s dreams are to be able to complete her studies, work in her profession, and in this way be able to support her family, located in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with seven children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa operated a food-making business, making consumables, like beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Mejumaa wants to purchase food items, like wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and to establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, like wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es: Don Adalid, tiene 32 años de edad, su familia está compuesta de siete miembros; cinco hijos y los padres, es una familia de escasos recursos económicos, vive en la comunidad de Mizque. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce cebolla, papa, arveja y frejol; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población. Don Adalid es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos. Desde muy pequeño trabaja en la agricultura, por la necesidad de recursos trabaja en las tierras de su padre y con mucho sacrificio agarra algunos recursos para los gastos de su familia, en la anterior campaña además de sembrar una superficie pequeña la helada afecto sus cultivos justo cuando estaba a punto de cosechar la arveja, la helada  quemo toda su producción. Don Adalid, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos para tener más producción y mejorar de esta manera la calidad  de vida y las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Don Adalid is 32 years old. His family consists of seven members, his five children and his parents. They have limited financial resources and live in the community of Mizque. Adalid works by farming and raising livestock. He produces onions, potatoes, peas, and beans and then sells them to the merchants who live in the same town. Don Adalid is a well-respected person in his community because of his dedication to his work and for being responsible in feeding and educating his children. He has worked in agriculture from a very young age because he needed income. Adalid worked on his father’s land and saved some of his income with great sacrifice for his family’s expenses. During the previous planting season, a small frost impacted his crops around the time that his crop of peas were ready to be harvested. The frost ruined his entire production.

Don Adalid is requesting his current loan so that he can buy more chemical fertilizers, organic fertilizers, and agrochemicals so that he can produce more and improve his quality of life and the living conditions for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers, organic fertilizers, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Muhtabar

texts.ru: Прекрасная женщина, которую зовут Мухтабар, хочет организовать новый бизнес. Она много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес производством лепешки. Она умеет печь очень вкусные лепешки. Мухтабар обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Она будет реализовать лепешки на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки муки, тандура(национальная печка, где пекут лепешки). Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A wonderful woman, whose name is Muhtabar, wants to organize a new business.  She has not had a source of income for a long time.  Because her husband has a small salary, he cannot provide their children with all of the necessities.  The children demand more comforts year after year because they grow together with the developing world.  Muhtabar decided to start a business of making flatbread.  She can bake very delicious flatbread.  Muhtabar completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women.  She participated in this course and obtained a lot of positives for herself.  She received a certificate after completing the course.  She will sell flatbread at a local market.  Muhtabar is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy flour and tandoor (national oven for baking flatbread).  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour and tandoor in order to start her own business

loans.name: Novavilla

texts.en: Novavilla is a 27-year-old, married woman from Bohol, Philippines. Novavilla has been engaged in a farming business for more than three years with her husband. The business is their income source. Novavilla is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Novavilla hopes to make their farming venture a success and a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alcoreza. Tiene un automovil que lo dispone para transporte público ya que en su hogar requieren de todos los ingresos posibles para cubrir los gastos mensuales de la familia. Ella solicitó el crédito para el mantenimiento de dicha movilidad.

El sueño de Silvia es independizarse y poder salir adelante por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Silvia is single and lives with her parents in the Alcoreza zone.  She has a car that she uses to provide public transportation services, since she needs all the income she can get to cover the family’s monthly expenses.  She is asking for this loan to maintain said vehicle.

Silvia’s dream is to become independent and be able to get ahead on her own.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.name: Aygul

texts.ru: Айгул 43 года, замужем, имеет 2 дочерей. Образование-высшее, работает в сельской конторе. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В целях дополнительных доходов Айгул на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря терпению и упорному труду Айгул, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 1 дойную корову, 25 овец. Также в наличии имеет 1,72 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает картошку, фасоль и многолетние травы. Дополнительный доход в сумме 4550 сом (KGS) Айгул получает от продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем намерена приготовить приданое для своей дочери.
texts.en: Aygul is 43 years old, married and two daughters.  She has a higher education and works at a village office.  Her husband helps her with the business.  To provide additional income, Aygul has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - for many years.  Thanks to Atyrkul's patience and hard work, today she has one dairy cow and twenty-five sheep on her farm.  She also has 1.72 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually plants potatoes, beans and perennial herbs.  Aygul receives an additional income of 4550 som (KGS) from selling milk.  In order to further develop her business, Aygul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy two cows.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and also intends to prepare a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркул 51 год, замужем, имеет 1 сына. Образование-высшее, работает почтальоном в сельской конторе. Супруг работает в строительной компании. В целях дополнительных доходов Атыркул на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Атыркул, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленка, 10 овец. Также в наличии имеет 2,58 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает перец и фасоль. Дополнительный доход в сумме 5400 сом (KGS) Атыркул получает от продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Атыркул обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем намерена купить трактор для обработки земли.
texts.en: Atyrkul is 51 years old, married and has one son.  She has a higher education and works as a post office worker at a village office.  Her husband works at a construction company.  To provide additional income, Atyrkul has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - for many years.  Thanks to Atyrkul's hard work, today she has three dairy cows, one calf and ten sheep on her farm.  She also has 2.58 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually plants peppers and beans.  Atyrkul receives an additional income of 5400 som (KGS) from selling milk.  In order to further develop her business, Atyrkul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy two cows.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and also intends to purchase a tractor for treating the land in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns income from a general store.  She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen se graduó de técnico en educación básica en la universidad sin embargo no ha ejercido la profesión ya que ella tiene que cuidar a sus dos hijos menores y a su mama. Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde pequeña sus hijos el mayor de 25 años solo curso el ciclo común, la segunda tiene 23 años la tercera tiene 20 años quienes tienen 5 años de haber emigrado hacia los estados unidos hoy en día ya tienen residencia. Sus otros 2 hijos que son los menores la niña de 14 años está cursando el segundo año del ciclo común y el ultimo hijo tiene 12 años y está cursando el primer año del ciclo común en un colegio de la comunidad. La tierra que ella trabaja en compañía de su pareja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de su padre antes de fallecer la cual está a 40 minutos de su casa de habitación a pie y a 10 minutos en vehículo. 

Ella necesita proteger sus cultivos de café por lo cual ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra abono, limpieza, fertilización entre otras actividades que ayuden a mejorar el proceso de desarrollo del café esto con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos y una excelente producción. 

Uno de sus más grandes sueños es hacer su propia casa de habitación en una propiedad que tiene en la misma comunidad y que ella y sus hijos menores dejen de andar alquilando o evitar vivir con sus familiares y que cuando sus hijos regresen tengan un hogar digno que les reciba.
texts.en:
María del Carmen graduated as a basic education specialist from the university, however she has not exercised this profession since she has to take care of her two young children and her mother. Her parents taught her to work the land since she was little. Her children, the oldest 25 years old, is only studying the core classes, the second is 23 years old, the third is 20 years old, all of who have emigrated to the United States 5 years ago. Currently, they have residence. Her other two children that are younger: the daughter of 14 years is studying in her second year of core classes and the last son is 12 years old and studying in his first year of core classes in a community school.

The land that she works with her partner is thanks to an inheritance from her father before his death. It is 40 minutes from her home by foot and 10 minutes by car. She needs to protect her coffee plants for which is has requested a loan from the communal bank COMIXMUL to buy manure, 
cleaning and fertilizing among other work which will help to improve the coffee development process. This is with a goal to earn more income and an excellent harvest. 

One of her biggest dreams is to make her own house on a property that is in the same neighborhood and for her and her younger children to stop renting or avoid living with her family, and when her children return they will have a dignified home to welcome them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and clean her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns income from buying and selling nipa.

Gina is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy bamboo, wood, paint, and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, wood, paint, and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell. Diana has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming/selling vegetables.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodora is 40 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and insecticides. Teodora has been farming corn for six years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
This is Jenita. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 26,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jenita hopes to give her children a good life and education and dreams that her business will flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Simforiana

texts.en:
Simforiana is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six children. Simforiana works hard in order to support her husband in tilling their farm. 

Simforiana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and harvest. Simforiana has hopes of expanding their farming venture and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane has been a speech therapist for 5 years and lives with her husband and two school-aged children, 11 and 7. She works with children who have disabilities and need specialists like her to maintain communication with the outside world. She holds lessons at her house, which is located in Metsamor, Armavir. Due to her kind and professional attitude toward children, she is known in her town as a good specialist. With great care, she teaches children who can't communicate with people or can't pronounce words correctly.

Gayane requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to purchase supplies she needs for her work, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Gayane has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides informal businesses that do not have access to credit products with start-up loans with soft conditions. This new initiative will significantly improve Gayane's teaching conditions, as she will be able to purchase technical supplies for kids (computer, clipboard).

Gayane will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support. The loan is important for her to improve her work, which is very important to society.

loans.use: to pay for technical supplies to teach children with disabilities

loans.name: Ma. Aniceta

texts.en:
Ma.Aniceta is a 33-year-old  married woman from Getafe, Bohol, a mother of six children.The oldest child is 14 while the youngest is 10 months old. She is engaged in food vending. She sells snack foods like rice cake and juice to earn a living. She has been selling rice cake for almost three years.

Due to being financially unstable, Ma. Aniceta requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and more juice flavoring to augment her income and to cater for her customers' needs. In the future, Ma.Aniceta would like to improve her food vending business to become successful and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and more juice flavoring

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is married and lives in Pagadian City with her family. She is 33 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband works as seaman while she earns additional income by renting out a motorcycle. She joined Gata Daku MPC last year as a way to improve her business, and is requesting this loan to buy another motorcycle to rent out. She hopes to save a portion of her income to improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

Hayde has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough so she could send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Barbara has borrowed and repaid 7 prior loans from NWTF. She has been running the charcoal business for 2 years and also earns income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina. She previously obtained a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she used to buy ingredients to make peanut butter and stuffed meat. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will use it to again buy ingredients to make peanut butter (sugar, peanuts, vegetable oil) and stuffed meat. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase, with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rufina dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the ingredients to make more peanut butter and stuffed meat.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like eggs, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries for her general store business.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like eggs, snack foods, soft drinks, shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries

loans.name: Marigel

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Marigel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by buying and selling nipa, a type of leaf used as a building material. Marigel is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional nets and other materials she uses when fishing. She has maintained her business for the last two years with loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fishing materials

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 34 years old, has two small children, and lives with her family in the city of Vanadzor. She has higher education and a specialty in garment technology. She does shift work at the Lori Regional Rescue Department as a telephonist. On free days from her first job, she also works as a fur designer at the fur processing workshop. She gets very tired, since she also has a lot of work to do at home, and first of all, she must manage to take care of her children properly, despite her tiredness.

Narine's family needs heating in their flat. Accordingly, she asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy heating equipment, which will help her family to get through the winter months warmly and comfortably. In the photo, Narine shows the place in her kitchen where she intends to install the heating system.

loans.use: To install a heating system in her flat

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Marlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like spices, sugar, cream, eggs, and coffee.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like spices, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children; five attend school but one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamisi operates a food-making business, making staples like rice. preparing tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

 With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase food items, rice, wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and beans for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, rice, wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and beans for her business

loans.name: Feni

texts.en:
Feni appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to add more stock for her business; thus she generated profits she used to pay school fees for her children.

She is requesting Ksh. 20,000 to purchase two bags of potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, and sugar for her business.

She joined Yehu to access the loan funds that will help her boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Edson, de 20 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres en la casa de ellos, desde que nació. 
Edson se dedica a la agricultura, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres siembra alverja, habas y demás hortalizas los que cuida con mucho esmero, pues dentro de 4 meses le darán buenos resultados. Comenta que su mayor sueño es estudiar agronomía y mejorar sus plantaciones para convertirlas en las mejores. Ahora se encuentra trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para ahorrar lo necesario y emprender este camino. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Edson, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Edson, who is 20-years old, is a hardworking young man.  He has lived with his parents in their home since he was born. 
Edson makes his living in agriculture.  On the land he was given by his parents, he plants peas, beans and other vegetables.  He takes very good care of his plants, and within four months, he will have a good harvest.  Edson says that his greatest dream is to study agronomy and improve his fields, so they become the best.  He is working hard to save what he needs to start along that path.  This is Edson's first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial help he is receiving to keep moving forward.  In addition, he promises to punctually comply with his repayment plan.  Edson will invest the S/.1000 soles (USD $375) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish his sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Alili

texts.en:
Alili is a widow and has three children. She is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. 

To make a living, Alili is running her own  general store and has been in her business for more than three years. She earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Alili is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and dairy products. Alili joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and dairy products

loans.name: Maripa

texts.ru: Марипе 51 год, замужем, имеет 2 детей. С 1985 года в поисках доходов для своей семьи Марипа стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Марипа достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Марипы имеется: 1 дойная корова, 20 овец. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел 2,58 ГА на обработку и посадку фасоли и картофеля. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Марипа обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Марипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует купить автомашину.
texts.en: Maripa is 51 years old, married and has two children.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Maripa became involved in farming and animal husbandry in 1985.  She started with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Maripa's hard labor and diligent work, she achieved decent successes in developing her business and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today Maripa's farm contains one dairy cow and twenty sheep.  She also has 2.58 hectares of land for planting beans and potatoes.  Her husband and children help with the business.  In order to further develop her business, Maripa requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her small business and also plans to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui font toutes du commerce. Elles habitent le même quartier et ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Astou est la représentante du groupe. elle a 33 ans ,mariée et mère d'un garçon de 12 ans et de 2 filles de 7 et 3 ans. elle fait de l'aviculture dans un terrain près de chez elle. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 264 poussins à 66000f ,6 sacs d'aliment poussin démarrage à 93000,15  sacs d'aliments croissance à 232500f 7 sacs d'aliment finition  à 108500f. Elle mène cette activité depuis 3 ans et s'en sort très bien car tout le quartier s'approvisionne chez elle ainsi que ses collègues de travail. avec ses bénéfices elle renforce son activité et participe au construction de leur maison familiale.
texts.en:
This group is composed of five women who are all engaged in commercial activities. They live in the same neighborhood and support each other very well. 

Astou is the representative of the group. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of a boy of 12 and two girls of 7 and 3 years old. She raises chickens in a lot near her home. With her loan she intends to buy 264 chicks for 66000 francs, 6 sacks of starter mash for chicks for 93,000 francs, 15  sacks of intermediate growth feed for 232,500 francs and  7 sacks of finishing feed for 108,500 francs. She has been in this business for three years now and does well since the whole neighborhood buys from her, as well as her colleagues from work. With her profits, she will expand her activity and participate in building their family home.

loans.use: to buy 264 chicks to raise and feed for their various growth stages.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, de 49 años es una mujer muy alegre. Vive en la casa que compró hace 27 años junto a su esposo Vidal, con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellas y su pequeña nieta. Claudia se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a su terreno, donde cuida de sus vacas y elabora queso con la leche que produce. Pero la actividad que realizó, por más de 15 años es la agricultura, tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra maíz, papa y alverja, “siembro en cantidad, por ello necesito capital de trabajo, ya que el dinero no produce por meses, hasta la cosecha, donde vendo mis alimentos”, comenta. Es así que cuida mucho de sus cultivos, pues depende mucho de ellos para obtener buenas ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Claudia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Claudia is 49 years old and is a very happy woman.  She lives in a house that she bought with her husband, Vidal, 27 years ago.  They have seven children but only two still live with them, along with her little granddaughter.   Claudia farms and also raises livestock.  Every morning she goes out to her land where she cares for her cattle and makes cheese with the milk they produce, but she has been farming for more than 15 years.  She has her own farmland where she raises corn, potatoes, and peas, “I plant in quantity, so I need working capital since the money doesn’t come for months, until the harvest, when I sell my food,” she says.  This is how she cares for her crops and she depends greatly on them to have good earnings.  This will be her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she gets that helps her get ahead.  She also promises to be on time with her payments.  Claudia will use the S/500 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada desde hace 18 años junto a su esposo Iván y sus tres menores hijos, a los que desea dar una mejor vida. Julia se dedica a la agricultura. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra alverja, ya que este producto se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar de sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de su localidad, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Julia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Julia, 38, is a very loving and hardworking mother. She has been renting a home for 18 years together with her husband Ivan and her three youngest children whom she hopes to give a better life. 

Julia works in farming. After a lot of hard work she has been able to make her land very productive and now she sows everything, since she knows that everything she grows will be good quality. Her main crop is peas, as they sell very well at the market. The thing she likes most about her job is protecting her fields from the plagues that can affect them. She has been working in this area for 11 years and considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be transporting her produce to her local wholesale market, which is where she sells her produce. 

For the future of her business, Julia hopes to get the necessary funds together to put up a stall at the wholesale market where she currently sells her produce as a street vendor. This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she feels that this loan will be very beneficial for her economic growth. Knowing this, she promises to make her repayments punctually. Julia will invest 1000 soles in the purchase of organic fertiliser to provide nutrients for her fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, three of whom in school, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Alma is borrowing 14500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Pathos Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyamulemba est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Pathmos», entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 38 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants  qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse Maïs. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 10 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Nyamulemba is the leader of the business group called «Pathos», and an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur. She is 38 years old, a widowed mother of eight children who are all enrolled in school. She sells maize. She displays her products at her home. 

She began her business with money received from her husband about 10 years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy two sacks of maize. In this way, she hopes to grow her business, pay school fees and feed her children, and buy a plot of land for the family. Lacking capital hinders the development of her business. 

She would like to thank Hekima sincerely for supporting small-scale entrepreneurs with micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha de 27 años, está casada con Jilmer con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años. Ella y su familia viven en la casa que compró hace 2 años. Mirtha es agricultora, le gusta el trabajo del campo, porque se siente libre y todo lo que obtiene es por su esfuerzo. Siembra arvejas, habas, maíz, papa, verdura y demás hortalizas; pero da prioridad al cultivo de papas y arvejas, pues tiene mayores ingresos por estas cosechas.
“Hace 4 años que me dedico a la siembra y si es rentable, todo depende de la perseverancia y a la valentía de arriesgar”, comenta. Todo su trabajo está orientado al progreso de su familia pues sabe que tiene que forjar un buen futuro para su hijo. Mirtha también cuenta con vacas que le proporcionan leche y toros que utiliza para arar la tierra. Una de sus metas es adquirir sus propios terrenos y así ahorrarse en el arriendo que paga cada vez que quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Mirtha, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 27 years old and married to Jilmer, with whom she has a 5 year old son. She and her family live in a house they bought two years ago. 

Mirtha is a farmer. She likes working in the field because she feels free and everything she grows is a result of her own effort. She sows peas, broad beans, corn, potatoes, leafy greens and other vegetables; however her priorities are her potato and pea crops because she is able to make the biggest profits from these crops.

Mirtha says “it’s been four years since I started cultivating the land and it is profitable, but everything depends on your perseverance and your willingness to take risks”. All of her work is aimed at improving the life of her family, since she knows that she needs to create a bright future for her son. Mirtha also has cows which give her milk and bulls which she uses to plow the land. One of her goals is to acquire her own land so that she can save on the rent that she pays every time she wants to sow in bulk. 

This is Mirtha’s fifth loan with Kiva. She feels grateful for the financial support that she receives which allows her to move forward and she also promises to make her repayments punctually. Mirtha will invest 2500 soles in the purchase of organic fertiliser to provide nutrients for her fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 47-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children, from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food-vending, like flour, sugar, and milk. With this loan, she will be able to cook more snack foods which she can sell to her customers and buyers. 

Susana dreams of expanding her business, so that it will generate more revenue necessary to meet the family's needs, like food and the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food-vending, like flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Sayniso

texts.en:
A woman who is kind needs financial support. Her name is Sayniso. She is 60 years old. She has three children and she is the main bread-winner in the family. She lives in a village. 

Local people have been busy with animal husbandry and farming. Eighteen years ago, Sayniso began to own a business dealing with farming. She grows vegetables, such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She works every day from early morning until late evening on her own land. She knows her business very well and has great experience. She has been managing with the business alone. She sells her harvest at the local market. She has her own customers since her harvest has high quality. 

She wants to make a present for her daughter since she married some months ago. She wants to make a present for her daughter’s new household. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of TJS 2,000 (somoni) to buy furniture. She has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughter.

loans.name: Finangnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FINANGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adonègbo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adonègbo est âgée de 54 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Adonègbo a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Adonègbo vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différents besoins. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Adonègbo produit de l'huile de palme à base de noix de palme qu'elle vend dans sa région. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie ainsi que celui de ses enfants. Adonègbo s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Adonègbo sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FINANGNON, un crédit.
texts.en:
The group FINANGNON is composed of four persons who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their businesses. The group's representative, Adonègbo, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 54 years old and no longer lives with her husband. Adonègbo has four children, all provided with education. Two of the children are in her care. Adonègbo lives by herself with her children and is alone in ensuring that their different needs are met. 

For about twenty years, she has been producing palm oil from palm nuts that she sells in the region. This business enables her to support herself and to improve her living conditions, as well as those of her children. She gets her supplies in the region. 

Seeking to satisfy her customer and to grow her revenues, Adonègbo along with the other members of the group FINANGNON are requesting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts to produce palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the ceiling of a room.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.es: Merlyn, de 20 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Damian y su pequeño hijo, en la casa que compraron hace 2 años. Mientras que su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados. Ella apoyo mucho en el cuidado de sus sembríos, cuenta que en los terrenos agrícolas que posee siembra papa, maíz, habas y demás hortalizas, gusta mucho de su trabajo pues no tiene dificultad con el riego ya que cuentas con agua y eso le ayuda a mantener sus cultivos en óptimas condiciones. Por ello espera con muchas ansias poder ahorrar para comprar más terrenos agrícolas ya que hay temporadas de cosecha en las que no se abastece. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Merlyn, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Merlyn, age 20, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Damian and their small child in their home, which they bought two years ago. Her husband makes a living buying and selling livestock. She helps out a lot by taking care of the crops, and tells us that they plant potato, corn, beans, and vegetables on their land. She really enjoys her work, and she doesn't have any problems with irrigation because they have water already and this helps keep the crops in optimal conditions. She is very anxious to be able to save in order to buy more land, since there are times where what they have is not enough. This is her first loan on Kiva. She feels that this loan will be very beneficial in her economic growth, so she promises to repay her quotas punctually. Merlyn will invest the 300 soles in the purchase of manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredo su madre junto a su hijo. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Maximiliana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de papa y alverja, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Maximiliana, invertirá los S/.2500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Maximiliana, who is 53-years old, is a very happy and hardworking mother.  She and her son live in the house that she inherited from her mother.  The produce that Maximiliana has grown with much effort and dedication has helped her a lot in the progress of her life.  She starts out every morning working her land, as she knows that the quality she obtains from her potatoes and peas will depend on the care she gives to them.  What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops.  She feels very happy seeing them large and abundant.  Maximiliana has been in this trade for 23 years, and she feels that the most difficult part is getting her harvest to the market in Tarma, which is the place she sells her produce, as the sacks of produce are very heavy.  In the future, she hopes to improve her produce to get better prices.  This is her fifth loan with Kiva.  She feels that this loan will be very beneficial in her financial growth, and so she promises to punctually repay the loan.  Maximiliana will invest the S/.2500 ($900 USD) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 33 años, es una mujer muy feliz; pues vive junto a su esposo Freddy y sus dos hijos en una casa alquilada. Luzmila se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverjas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de su esposo, pues le ayuda en los constantes cuidados que le brinda a sus sembríos. Además de tener los terrenos cerca al río lo cual le beneficia en el crecimiento inmediato de sus cultivos. “Ahora estoy en la cosecha de alverja, donde obtendré buenas ganancias”, afirma. Su principal problema son los gastos de los estudios de su hijo mayor, pues comenzó a estudiar y ahora minimiza los gastos de mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Luzmila espera comprar su propia casa, y de esa manera aliviar los gastos de alquiler. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Luzmila, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 33, is a very happy woman who lives with her husband, Freddy, and their 2 children in a rented home.  Luzmila is a farmer who grows mainly peas, corn and other vegetables.  What she likes most about her work is the support that she gets from her husband, as he helps her with the constant work of caring for the crops.  Luzmila's land is near the river which benefits her in that her crops grow immediately. "Right now I am harvesting peas, which will make me good profits", she says. Luzmila's main problem is not having money for her eldest son's studies since he has started school and now she minimizes the money she puts into maintaining her crops.  Luzmila hopes to buy her own house in the future so that she can reduce the money she pays out in rent.

This is Luzmila's fifth loan with Kiva. She feels that this loan will be very beneficial for her financial growth, and she promises to  make her payments on time.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles from this loan to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Xiomara, es habitante del barrio cuba una zona con pobladores de muy escasos recursos económicos, por 25 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como docente en una escuela, lugar donde también labora su pareja. Sus hijos ya todos son mayores e independientes. Ella solicita el crédito para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones con hoyos, facilitando la filtración de agua cuando llueve, con el financiamiento le será posible comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, esto le permitirá habitar en condiciones más segura junto a su familia.
texts.en: Xiomara lives in the Cuba neighbourhood, an area where the residents have very few economic resources. She has worked as a teacher for 25 years. Her partner works there as well. Their children are already grown and independent. She is requesting a loan to repair the roof of her home. The roof is in very bad condition and has holes which allow water to get in when it rains. With this loan it will be possible for her to buy zinc laminate and purlins. This will allow her to live in more secure conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy zinc laminate and purlins.

loans.name: John

texts.es: John, de 23 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus dos hermanos, a los que apoya económicamente en su casa propia. Desde muy niño ayudó a sus padres en la limpieza de la maleza que crecía constantemente en sus cultivos. Desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario con el oficio de su familia. Hace algún tiempo comenzó a sembrar en su propio terreno agrícola. Donde esparce semillas de alverja, habas, papa y hortalizas. Los cuales intercala de acuerdo a la temporada de sembrío. Vendiendo sus cosechas a unos intermediarios mayoristas de un pueblo cercano. Asimismo le falta muy poco para terminar sus estudios de mantenimiento de maquinarias, donde invierte dinero mensualmente. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. John, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
John, 23, is a young worker who lives with his parents and two siblings, whom he supports financially in his own house.  Ever since he was a child, he helped his parents with clearing the weeds that constantly grew in their crops.  From that time, he learned everything he needed to know about farming, his family's line of work.  Some time ago, he started to cultivate on his own lands where he plants seeds of peas, beans, potatoes, and other vegetables.  He plants according to the seeding season, and he sells his harvests to the wholesale intermediaries in a town close-by.  

Also, John is very close to finishing his studies in machine maintenance, which he pays for on a monthly basis.  This is his 3rd loan with Kiva, and he thinks that this loan will be very beneficial for his financial growth.  He promises to make his payments on time.  John will invest the 3,800 Peruvian soles he requests in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a single entrepreneur living in Upper Bayao, Tukuran with her parents. 

To earn a living, she operates her own general store, selling assorted home-use products in her community. She earns PHP 3,400 a month from her store. She has been in her business for two years since she had stopped her studies. 

Her earnings from her loan would help to support the basic needs of her family. She plans to use her revenue as additional capital to earn more for the improvement of the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bottled products, dairy, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emerita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Emerita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable-selling business.

Emerita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable-selling and motorcycle transport businesses.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Savet's Group

texts.en:
Savet, aged 51 and living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, has four children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on one hectare of farmland. They have been in this business for twenty years. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Savet has been with VisionFund for four cycles, and now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. Savet will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner so as to sell it for a good price to make her daily living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.en:
The eight members of the La Paz (Peace) group from San Miguel Dueñas have a variety of businesses including selling wood, cosmetics or flowers.  There are also some tiny stores, food vendors and a business selling bubbles. The average age of this group of hard working women is 38 and they have had an average of four years of school. These women are excited to be part of this group since Namaste Guatemaya is the first organization to give them the opportunity to learn how to manage their business and their money in addition to offering microcredit.  

Ingrid Yolanda (third from right) is a 37-year-old widow with four children - 3 sons aged 18, 17 and 16 and a daughter aged 12.  Her husband died in an automobile accident when she was pregnant with her daughter.  Her business is selling small bottles of bubble-making solution with wands for blowing bubbles.  She mixes shampoo, a natural glue and water, and bottles it in small bottles.  She also makes the wands out of wire.  She sells these at fairs and fiestas throughout her part of the country.  Bubbles are popular at Guatemalan fairs.  She started this business when she was seven, to bring additional income to her parents.  She continued the business when she was married and now she supports herself and her children with a little help from her oldest son who works as a construction helper.  Her other children help her in her business.  Only her youngest child is still in school.

Her monthly income is 2000 Quetzales (US $256) with a profit of Q1200 (US $153).  With her loan she plans to travel to Guatemala City to buy solutions, bottles and wire in bulk.  Her projected profit with her new business plan and buying in bulk is Q1876 (US $240) which is an increase of 56% and will allow her to better feed her family and perhaps allow one or two of the boys to return to school.

loans.use: to buy in bulk the supplies she needs for her business selling bubbles at fairs and fiestas.

loans.name: Elwin Alexander

texts.es:
Elwin, está casado vive con su esposa y su hija. El, se dedica  a la venta de verduras y frutas, asimismo  a la agricultura, lo realiza junto con su esposa en horarios de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de frutas y verduras, tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, peras y también tomates, chiles, cebollas, entre otras. Esta inversión le ayudara a tener más productos  de inversión y para ofrecerle a la clientela.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio  de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Elwin is married and lives with his wife and daughter.  He makes his living selling vegetables and fruits.  Additionally, he earns a living in agriculture.  He works together with his wife from 6:00am to 2:00pm.
The loan that Elwin is requesting will allow him to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as: apples, grapes, oranges, pears and also tomatoes, chiles, onions and other items.  This investment will help him to have more investment products to offer to his clientele. 
Elwin's dream is to expand his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, oranges, pears and also tomatoes, chiles, onions and other items.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Armandine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Armandine est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Armandine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de dix ans que Armandine mène comme activité la vente de bols, plastiques et de bassines en aluminium dans sa région. Armandine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Armandine désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO.
texts.en: The group JESUKPEGO has three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Armandine, has her hand raised in the photo. Armandine is 27 years old and married to a man named Benoit. The couple has two school aged children for whom they are responsible. Armandine never completed much schooling. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. For about the past 10 years, Armadine has sold bowl sets, plastic containers and aluminum bowls in her area. She purchases her inventory in a city in Bénin. In order to strengthen sales and respond better to her client's demands, Armandine is requested this loan along with the other members of JESUKPEGO.

loans.use: to purchase bowl sets, plastic containers and aluminum bowls.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier.  La représentante du  groupe, Juridithe (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Abel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Juridithe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de quinze ans, Juridithe vend des tissus et des bijoux dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Juridithe vend des produits cosmétiques. Juridithe s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Juridithe et les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: FIFONSI has three members who all live in the same neighborhood.  The group representative, Juridithe (hand raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a man named Abel. The couple has three children who attend school, with two who are still their financial responsibility. Juridithe lives together her children and husband and together they are responsible for the household expenses. For about the past 15 years, Juridithe sells fabric and jewelry in her area. As a side business, she also sells cosmetics. Juridithe buys her inventory in a city in Benin. This is the third time Juridithe and the other members of FIFONSI have requested a loan with ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to client demand. The first two loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and jewelry.

loans.name: Las Chijinis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CHIJINIS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de tejidos, tienda de pintura, tienda de barrio, venta de detergentes, taller de metalmecánica.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que anteriormente ella vendía jugos, posteriormente decide realizar almuerzos a solicitud de su clientela.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, papas y pollos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la orientación de las asesoras de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Chijinis” will start its third lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Collpani.  It is made up of eight members and run by a board of directors, of which Señora Rosmery is the President.  The communal bank members' businesses are varied and include: making fabric, a paint store, a neighborhood store, selling detergents and a metallurgical workshop. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the small business owners, of which Señora Rosmery is one.  She says that this is her third cycle with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to join by an outreach worker from the institution who visited her in her home.  Señora Rosmery currently has a business selling food.  Previously she sold juices, and later decided to make lunches, at the request of her clientele. 
 
The loan that she is taking out will increase her capital (to purchase rice, potatoes and chicken) that she acquires in the markets in El Alto and later to make and sell the food from her sales stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income for her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Rosmery says that she likes the orientations from the loan counselors.

loans.use: to purchase rice, potatoes and chicken.

loans.name: Reina De Jesus

texts.es:
Reina, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la venta de mariscos; este le servirá para comprar pescado rojo y blanco, curbina, macarela, camarón, lonja de tiburón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que le permitió adquirir variedad de mariscos. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina is in need of a new loan so that she can continue to invest in seafood for resale.  She will use the proceeds to purchase white as well as red varieties of fish, curbina, mackerel, shrimp, shark steaks and other items.

Her previous loan was very helpful, since it enabled her to acquire a variety of seafood.  Her financial situation and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy white as well as red varieties of fish, curbina, mackerel, shrimp, shark steaks and other items.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Perla has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milagro Gregoria

texts.es:
Milagro, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: leña, maíz y gas.
Cuenta la Sra. Milagro que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones  económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Milagro needs to get a new loan to continue investing in her business selling tortillas.  This will help her buy the ingredients, such as firewood, corn, and gas.

Milagro says the previous loan helped her increase her sales and earn more income.  Her economic situation has improved and her family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and gas

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
Alina, de 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos queridos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad respectivamente quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los verdes campos de su localidad, Alina tiene sus cultivos de papa y alverja, todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima sale a trabajar sus tierras, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento económico por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Alina, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alina, 33, is a very modest and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her two beloved children, ages 6 and 2, who are the motivation for all her efforts.

Alina has her potato and pea crops in the green fields of her town.   Every morning, regardless of the weather, she goes to her fields to work with great care.  She has 15 years of experience and considers the hardest part to be fumigating her crops.  In time she wants to buy more land to increase her production.

This is her fifth Kiva loan.  She feels it'll be very beneficial to her economic growth, so she promises to make her payments punctually.

Alina will invest the 3000 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mao, 22, has one child. Mao and her husband are farmers who plant corn on one hectare of farmland and also work as paid workers to earn additional income. Mao can earn about 13,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Mao is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan 500,000 KHR each. Mao will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her corn healthily and also hopes to grow more corn to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
Maria Eugenia, 29, is a young mother of three that lives with her family in Totolapan, Morelos. Maria walks almost 10km (6 miles) every morning to sell the vegetables and beans that her family plants. She is determined to make the trip and other sacrifices to give her children a better life. Maria´s house only has one bedroom where she sleeps with her husband Franco, a construction worker, and their three children Brenda, Emily and Franco junior. 

Maria and Franco together make around USD400 a month, so the house that they have today is the result of years of work and savings. Since Maria and Franco do not have formal jobs and their income is low and variable, neither of them have access to credit from banks or other organizations.

Maria has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for her kids and a bathroom for the family.  She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. Franco has the skills needed to complete the home. 

Maria and Franco will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new room will give the kids their own space to play, sleep and study and more privacy to Maria and Franco. Maria is a hard working mother that wants to give a better and more comfortable life to her kids.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a bedroom and bathroom for her three children

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe lives with her husband, Mario, and two children, Valeria and Alvaro, in Totolapan Morelos. Maria has been working in the market buying and selling vegetables since she was 12 years old, almost 11 years. Maria is known for being a hard working, loving mother and for selling the most flavorful vegetables. Maria and Mario work hard to give their children the opportunity they didn't have to study, at least through middle school, and have a better life.

Valeria and Alvaro are now two fast growing teenagers and sharing the room with their parents has become a challenge. They both need their own space to study, sleep and live. Maria is always looking out for her children and understands the importance of giving each of them their space at this critical age. Maria and Mario make no more than $450 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible to them.

For the last three months Maria and Mario have been saving to build two new rooms and one bathroom to their house. Maria needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials. This addition will give everyone the space they need and a space to fully develop. 

Maria and Mario will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new construction will give her children more time to study and do the homework since they will have their own space. Maria is aware that  dedication and hard work is what and will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room for her two children

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a vegetable farmer in Totolapan, Morelos. He cares and loves his vegetables only second after his wife Jenny and his two daughters Lissete and Barbara. Omar has been planting vegetables since he was a little boy and spends almost all his time in the field because he knows it is the only way to make sure his products will have the best quality.

Omar and his family live in a small house for four people with a tin roof. This house is the result of years of work of Omar and sacrifices the family had to make. The tin roof makes the house really humid in spring and summer and very cold in winter. These harsh conditions  have cause the family, especially the youngest daughter, to develop respiratory problems. 

Omar hopes to build a new room so the girls can stop sleeping in the living room and the parents can recover the family space. The girls are excited about having their own room and a place where they can sit with their family in the afternoons. 

Omar and Jenny have been saving for the last three months to replace the roof with a proper cement roof and to build a nice room for the kids. Omar spends the whole day at his work but unfortunately only makes around $350 USD a month and that only if he manages to sell everything. Because he has low income informal job, he does not have access to credit from other organizations. 

Omar is requesting this loan to finish paying for the materials he needs to build a proper roof and room for his girls. Omar will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. This home improvement is just another way for Omar to continue fighting to give a better life to his family and a better chance to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper roof for his house and a bedroom for his daughters

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.en:
Luis Ernesto is a farmer and the father of a son who suffers from a chronic illness and has breathing difficulties especially in his current home since it lacks proper insulation. 

Every morning Luis gets up at 3:00 am to work in the field. He plants tomatoes, cactus and cucumber in Totolapan, Morelos. Luis and Beatriz, his wife, are always trying to find new products to plant and sell to give their family a better life. Their hard work earns them roughly $350 USD a month.

Luis has worked hard to buy a piece of land and start building his house. He wishes to build a house that he can leave to his son and future members of his family. Right now his house only has a room and an open porch. Luis has been saving for the last three months to build two additional rooms and a bathroom. This loan will help him make the payment for the materials needed for construction. Luis has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and has irregular cash flows.
 
Luis and Beatriz will work together to build this addition to their home.
