The “ALPACOMA II” communal bank will start its fifteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors, of which Tatiana is the secretary. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling stamps, making bricks, selling chicken giblets and making chifles.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, one of whom is Tatiana. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years, joining at the invitation of her mother, who is a member of the institution. Right now she a has a brick factory. She learned this business as a child, since it was a family business. When she had a child she decided to set up her own workspace.   
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying an kiln. She will buy it from manufacturers in the city of El Alto and later set it up in her workspace to be able to distribute the merchandise to the retailers. This work allows her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, as she is single and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the credit and health trainings.

loans.use: to buy a kiln.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen, at the age of 31, found a means to make a living by providing electrician services. He repairs different type of technical machines and earns income for his family.
 
Armen lives and works in Gyumri town with his wife, 4-year-old son, mother and brother. He works hard to provide high quality service and gain more customers. Unfortunately, the income Armen gathers is hardly enough to cover the family's needs. As a result, there is no money left to invest in the business.

Armen has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but his loan request was rejected every time because the business isn't registered as a formal business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.

The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with easy conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

With the help of the loan Armen will be able to purchase supplies and will be able to continue providing electrician services to customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to provide electrician services to customers

loans.name: Ammer

texts.en: Ammer is a 24-year-old, who lives in Taiz, Yemen. Ammer's business is a small grocery store where he sells basic food materials and soft drinks. He has been in this business for one year. He tends to his customers who come to him every day. Firstly, his mother provided him with money to open a gas cylinder business then he expanded by opening a grocery store. He has applied for a youth loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials from AMB. With this money, he wants to buy grocery materials for his business. With the increased income, he will improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery material for his business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, transportation services, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding the cows.' Her biggest challenge is 'Cutting the cow's feed from the farm.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Brown.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They mostly like to deal with groups.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Florence replied 'More time will be created to do more economic work.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'cow, pig, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 40 años soltera y con el orgullo de haber sacado delante a sus 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa hecha de adobe. Cuando cumplió 23 años empezó a trabajar en los terrenos que su ex esposo poseía cultivando los productos mas rentables de la zona como son el cacao orgánico y barbasco. Comenta que al inicio no fue nada fácil trabajar porque no contaba con dinero suficiente para la compra de semillas y abono orgánico los cuales son indispensables para obtener una buena calidad de frutos. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de cultivo donde tiene más plantaciones de barbasco ya que el suelo que poseen sus parcelas favorecen a obtener una buena calidad de estos productos. Para el retiro y posterior venta de las raíces contrata a trabajadores del lugar quienes con mucho cuidado desentierran los tallos y envuelven con cuerdas hechas a base cáscara de troncos para que sean trasladados a la ciudad donde se ubican los centros de venta sin perder sus propiedades ya  que finalmente son usados para la fabricación de insecticidas naturales y otros derivados comerciales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y realizar la cosecha con 4 cuadras de barbasco que suele realizar periódicamente.
texts.en:
Adela is a 40 year old single woman who is proud to have gotten her 3 children ahead. She lives with them in her adobe house. When she turned 23, she started to work on land that her ex-husband had, growing the most profitable products in the area, such as organic cacao and barbasco. She says that at first it wasn't easy at all because she didn't have enough money to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, things that are necessary to  obtain a good quality fruit. Right now, she has 3 hectares of crops where she grows barbasco, since the soil on her land is favorable for obtaining a good quality of that products.  To harvest and latter sell the roots, she hires laborers from the area who very carefully dig up the stalks and wrap them in cords made from tree bark so they can be transported to the sales centers without losing their properties. They are used to make natural insecticide and for other commercial purposes. This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting to keep going ahead. She is committed to making her payments on time.

She would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers and harvest four fields of barbasco, which she does periodically.

loans.use: to hire laborers from the area.

loans.name: Laura Magdalena

texts.es:
Laura tiene 28  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos  hijos,  convive con su esposo e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Laura   se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de gallinas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  cada semana.  

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is 28 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton, province of   Los Ríos. 

The communal bank is called Avanza. Its members work in agriculture. All of them live in the area of the community Aguas Frías. They have practically grown up in the area. They work mainly in agriculture or with livestock. 

Laura works in agriculture. She grows corn and raises chickens. She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and other materials. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizer. She does her purchasing in Ventanas every week. Her dream is for her business to grow and her challenge is the competition. In her free time, she likes to get together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and other materials.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Don ángel es originario de la ciudad Estelí, tiene 61 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería hace  12 años lo cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrifico ha mantenido activo logrando dar estudio a sus hijos quienes son profesionales e independientes, tiene como apoyo a su esposa quien se dedica al servicio de la pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, maíz, azúcar, aceite, pasta dental, papel higiénico etc. con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y surtir su negocio con la  expectativa de prosperar siendo líder en el mercado. Su meta futuro es aumentar sus ingresos y tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Angel is originally from the city of Estelí. He is a 61-year-old married man with 4 children. He has had his own grocery store for 12 years. During that time, he has worked hard and sacrificed to be able to pay for his children's studies. They are now independent working professionals. He is supported by his wife, who also works at the grocery store. He is seeking a loan in order to buy products such as rice, corn, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and toilet paper, among other things, so as to meet his customers' demands and stock his store. He hopes that his business will prosper and become the leading local store. His goal for the future is to increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sugar, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter Kamau is 60 years old, from Nyandarua South and is married with grown-up children.

Peter is a farmer and has been in it for the past 8 years. He has applied for his seventh loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings, and also to pay for labour.

He hopes to be able to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been trading women’s clothing and underwear in Spitak town and its neighboring villages. For purchasing the inventory that she sells, Lilit goes 3 times a month to Yerevan town, purchases needed supplies and sells to locals.

Lilit lives in Spitak town with her two school-age children (her daughter is in the photo). It is very difficult for Lilit to sustain her family alone, but due to her hard work over 5 years, she was able to grow her children up. As the income she gathers is hardly enough for covering the family's costs, there is no money left for purchasing supplies for selling. Lilit requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because her business isn't registered as a formal business.

Lilit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Lilit will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to purchase supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new clothing supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Finding feeds for his goats.' His biggest challenge is 'Milking goats.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Brown.'

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'Groups guarantee each other's loans.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Peter replied 'More goats will lead to more income therefore improving the living standard of the family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following: 'cow, goats, pig, poultry, pump and motorcycle' but does not own 'bicycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water or sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 38-year-old, married father of three in Thika, runs a general store. He currently lacks enough funds to purchase stock to serve his evergrowing customer base.

With a loan through KADET Ltd., Stephen will be able to purchase more iron sheets, paint, cement, plumbing machines and tiles. Stephen is requesting his sixth loan from KADET Ltd. having completely repaid all his previous loans successfully. The additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. In the future, Stephen would like to invest in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more iron sheets, paint, cement, plumbing machines and tiles as stock for his general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old and has five children who are in school. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 18 years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She repaid her previous loan on time. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future she hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan, along with his family, lives in the village Gargar, which is in Lori region. He is 36 years old. Vachagan is married and he lives with his wife, two children and retired parents. He works as a locksmith in their village and he has shift work.

Simultaneously to his work, Vachagan has been engaged in beekeeping for the past 15 years.  His parents help him very much in the beekeeping activities and, as a result of their hard and honest work, they manage to have the sweetest and the purest honey in their village. Vachagan owns sixty beehives on his farm and at the same time he also breeds a cow, a calf and a piglet. Vachagan’s father is mainly engaged in land cultivation and they use the vegetables and fruits of their garden for their family.

Vachgan has decided to develop his farming as well and he asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and cows to develop his farm and thus increase his family's income

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 68 years old, married to Isaac, and they have five children who have their own families. She has been in the vegetable selling business for the past one year and has applied for her first loan from Kadet LTD to enable her to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and carrots, among others. She hopes to expand her business by buying still more stock with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Gladys hopes to own the biggest green grocery in Gilgil town.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, potatoes, and carrots, among others.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married to Simon, and they have three children who are in school. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 12 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy fertilizer, chemicals and seeds.She plans to expand her farming business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Esther hopes to expand her dairy farming so as to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis juillet 2007.,il est composé de membres issus du même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Celle qui léve son bras sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 42 ans,elle est veuve et mére de 04 enfants dont  02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de vêtements,elle fait ce type de vente depuis des années ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une clientéle qui lui est fidéle.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des tissus pour une valeur de 136500f et 200000f pour couvrir les frais scolaires de son fils étudiant.

Elle compte assurer les besoins de sa famille,la scolarité des enfants,leur nourriture et leur frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This group exists since July 2007 and is made up of members of the same neighbourhood who all work in commerce

The person who has her hand raised in the photograph is the leader of the group. She is a 42 year old widow with four children, two of which are girls.

Her business is clothing, she has been in this activity for some years which is why her customers are faithful to her.

With her loan she plans to buy fabrics worth 136500f and 200000f to cover the education costs for her son, who is a student.

She also plans to pay for her family's needs, her children's school fees, their food and their medical costs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 61 years old, married, and blessed with eight children who are now all adults.  He owns a retail shop in Kipkata and has been in operation over a period of 25 years, earning an income of Kes 5,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stock of sugar, washing detergents, and cooking oil among other goods for resale.  The profits he earns will be used to plough back into the business and add more stock.

His dream is to venture into wholesale supply.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, detergents, and cooking oil, among other goods

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma,  es una persona trabajadora, tiene 52 años de edad y dos hijos,  vive con su nieta, la cual tiene cinco años de edad. Ella, posee una tienda en su casa, la cual esta surtida y trabaja todos los días, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de primera necesidad, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, huevos, sal, jabón, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking woman. She is 52 years old, has 2 children and lives with her 5-year-old granddaughter. She has a well-stocked store in her home, where she has worked every day for the last 10 years.
The loan she is seeking will allow her to buy basic provisions such as beans, rice, sugar, eggs, salt and soap, among other items. This investment will help her build her inventory and increase her revenues.
Her dream is to strengthen her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, eggs, salt and soap, among other items.

loans.name: Tarxan

texts.en: Tarxan is 45 years old, married, and has two daughters. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Kalbajdar region of Azerbaijan, who now lives in the Baku region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income, while his daughters go to school. Tarxan started his taxi business two years ago. Unfortunately, as you can see in the photo, Tarxan has been involved in an accident. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to repair his car. In the future, he wants to buy a new car as this will be more profitable for his business. Tarxan is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Diary's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2009.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 29 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes et d'arachide,elle a une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis sa jeunesse.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter de l'arachide pour une valeur de 20000f et des légumes pour une valeur de 175000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2009. It is made up of people who live in the same neighbourhood and who work in commerce.

The person on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group, she is 29 and married with seven children.

Her activity is the sale of vegetables and groundnuts, she has much experience in this business as she has been doing it since she was young.

With her loan she plans to buy 20000f worth of groundnuts and 175000f worth of vegetables.

Her aim is to pay the school fees for her children and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Narek, at the age of 23, found a means to make a living by providing taxi service to locals. He lives in Vanadzor town with his mother and grandmother. Although Narek is young, he is already a very skilled driver and knows each place in town.

Unfortunately Narek's car broke down a month ago and he wasn't able to repair it because of financial difficulties. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but his loan request was rejected every time because the business isn't registered as a formal business.

Narek has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With this new initiative Narek is very motivated to repair his car, purchase tires and be able to continue his taxi business.

Narek waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs on his taxi and purchase tires

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 35 years old, married to Priscilla who is a farmer, and they have three children who are in school.

He has been in the transport business in Naivasha for the past five years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a cow. With anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

Duncan hopes to own a minibus in the near future so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 26-year-old man from Isampin which is located in Kilgoris, Kenya. He is single and supports his parents and other family members.

He is a farmer, which he has been doing for the last two years and generates a monthly income of Kes 25,000. He has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase seeds for maize and other crops. He will use the anticipated income to expand his farming.

His dream is to become a successful farmer and take good care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for maize and other crops

loans.name: Balakarim

texts.en:
Balakarim is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Baku region. Balakarim is married and has four children: three daughters and a son. 

Balakarim started his business four years ago to sell fruits and vegetables. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Balakarim wants to have a place for selling; this will be more profitable for his business. Balakarim is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fernando Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene cuatro  hijos,  convive con su esposa e hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Avanza, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura, todos viven en el sector del recinto Aguas Frías.
Prácticamente se han criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Fernando  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría de chanchos, gallinas, patos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  Ventanas  y  Mocache cada semana.  Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. 

Su desafío es la competencia.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta  reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is 39 years old. He has four children and lives in a civil union. He lives with his spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, in Provincia de los Ríos. 

He is a member of VRC AVANZA. The members of this group are all farmers who live the Recinto Aguas Frías area.
They grew up in this region and the majority earn a living working in agriculture or with livestock.

Fernando earns a living in agriculture, planting corn and raising pigs, hens and ducks. 

He is seeking this loan in order to buy manure, fertilizers and supplies. 

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers.  

He will make these purchases in Ventanas and Mocache on a weekly basis. His dream is for his business to grow.

His obstacle is the competition.  

In his free time, he likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Abdulghany

texts.en: Abdulghany is 29 years old, and is married man who has three children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a goods distributor; that is how he makes the effort to provide for himself and his family. His family is proud of him because he is a person who faced the difficult situations that happened to him. He intends to buy furniture for his house, but he doesn't have enough money, so he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture. He wishes to improve his living standards and build the second floor of his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the roof for the stable of the horse they use to transport loads

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is a taxi driver from the village of Arjut, where he lives with his wife and a little son. He has been providing a taxi service in his own car for four years. As the only breadwinner in the family, Telman works really hard to make enough income to meet his family's needs. Now, his car needs to be serviced, and the tires should be changed, but Telman has no money to do that. 

Telman has asked for a loan from local financial institutions several times, but his request has been rejected each time because his business is not formally registered. 

Telman has now been approved for a loan by a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to regular credit products.

This loan is very important for Telman to service his the car, replace his tires and be able to continue his business which is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the servicing of his car and the replacement of his tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of vegetables and food items, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of frozen fish.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a security guard; they have four children aged between 10 and 15 who are in school and living at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past nine years, she has been running a table from which she sells red oil in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she learned this way of trading from her friends. She started this business with money from her husband, and by means of taxi, she transports her goods to her shop every time.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She plans to buy a pieces of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 34 years old and lives in the West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She and her fiancee are living together with three children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of her kids are going to school. She is a grade-five dropout, and learned some business skills from friends. Her fiancee is a barber; notwithstanding that, she manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 

Over the past three years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her fiancee. She sells from the table for six days every week, spending nine hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm nuts, potatoes, greens, etc., for her business. She is happy to share her information with the lenders of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more palm nuts, potatoes, greens, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Mariama, who lives in West Point in Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known marketplaces in Montserrado county. She boasts of her high school diploma, and she said she is good at managing her home and business affairs. She is married to a security man, and they have a 13-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home. 

For the past years, she has been selling soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice in the local market. The problem she faces is sometimes slow buying, but most of the time she realizes a profit, and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies and juice for her business.
